Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: McKaps
Reviews.Content: The USPs of this hotel are the central location, the free apples and the unlimited supply of drinking water. That is quite something. The rooms are comfortable though small. The bathroom and the linen are clean. The reception assistance is very good, everybody speaking English . Any number of good eateries and food marts around. Walking distance to La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. Best advantage is the Caixa Calunya Square where the sight seeing buses have their major stop which is barely a few steps away. For a couple discovering the city on its own, that is a blessing. Because of the narrow lanes and the pubs below, the place is vibrant throughout the night Obviously ,be prepared to hear loud noises till the wee hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: travellerInfo29
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in the gothic quarters. The price is ok and the rooms (please note that I have only stayed in suits but have them been 3 persons) are big and nicely decorated. The service is ok but dont expect lots of extras. Even the breakfast for about 10 euro wasn't too bad. I have stayed here twice (2005 and 2012) and would stay here again. If u do stay here make sure you go to sagardi for Pinxos and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ATLTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We felt that Hotel Banys was simply an average property that has its location to thank for its popularity and maybe some past glory. We found the hotel staff to be a bit aloof. Their attitude only changed when we told them we would be checking out. Our room was dingy, the bathroom dark and lacked adequate lighting. The spring-loaded door wouldn't allow you to even keep the bathroom door open. The walls, and doors could have used a bit of attention with a fresh coat of paint and the furniture was a bit scuffed. The bed was hard and the mattress had seen better days. The small "toilet room" smelled as if it had not been cleaned from the previous guest. Hotel hallways were dark as well. As other reviews have mentioned, rooms in the front of the hotel can get loud but nothing that a pair of earplugs can't take care of. Overall, this hotel did not meet our expectations so we left after one night to find accommodations more suited to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JoonasH
Reviews.Content: Banys Orientals has rooms in two locations (close-by) in central Barcelona. The suites were spacious with nice dark wooden floors and minimalistic decorations. Much bigger than average hotel room, but facilities were limited and rooms were not equipped according to luxyry standard - good and comfortable but not luxury. There is a good restaurant next to the small lobby. Much of the action and sights are close-by, very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brad C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for our honeymoon and would happily stay there again. Nice welcome on arrival by friendly staff. Very clean hotel, and the room was something special... Very nicely furnished and a great comfortable feel to it. Located close enough to some major sights, we still managed to walk just about everywhere (but Barcelona is a big city so be warned that fitness and comfortable shoes are needed if you plan to walk). A very nice restaurant within the hotel, if not a little expensive but it was a 5* restaurant. 9/10 for food, quality, taste, presentation and service. Very close to some great off the beaten path restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scottyFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend. The staff were extremely helpful, making restaurant bookings, giving directions and advice etc. The rooms are small and a bit sombre, so I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic break.I just needed somehwere clean and central to sleep and it served its purpose. It is indeed a great location, at the start of El Born, near the metro station (Jaume), buses and a taxi stance. If you are a keen walker you can walk practically everywhere (beach, main shopping areas and sites in city centre) from there. I did not try the breakfast, or the restauarant, which I've heard is rather good.The rooms at the back are apparently quieter but smaller and darker. The shower is big and the hotel provides a trousse of toiletries. Also welcome is the free mineral water and fruit in the corridors to which guests can help themselves. The only improvement I would make is tea/coffee making facilities since there is no room service for breakfast. Some of us need a cuppa before we get dressed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and good value”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler4346
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel, although it offered no amenities, other than unlimited free bottled water and fresh apples in a bowl in the hallway. There is no lobby to speak of, but the room is a good size, the bed comfortable and free wi-fi. The location could not be better; the hotel is convenient to everything a tourist would want to do in Barcelona. Not all of the staff at the front desk spoke English, but they did try to be helpful. There is no full length mirror anywhere in the room, and the wooden floors in the hallways certainly carried the noise of anyone walking there at night. There is a well respected restaurant in the hotel, but apparently not really affiliated with it, which we thought was only fair and not up to its reputation. Our room had a double glass door opening onto a tiny balcony looking into an alleyway, which made our room rather dark. The furniture was modern just as the hotel photos show. All in all, we would recommend this hotel primarily for its terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: noonsky
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel - location was great, staff very welcoming and helpful and the rooms etc were lovely and old style. The fridges of complimentary water on each floor is an excellent idea. Would highly recommend this hotel. Lots of lovely bars, restaurants and shops close-by.

Reviews.Title: “Best Barcelona Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DibsyG
Reviews.Content: Just flew back from Barcelona where we had a fantastic time staying at this hotel. Well decorated, smart, with a good-sized room, well-stocked bathroom (huge shower) and free bottled water and fruit on every floor. The service was excellent, very polite helpful staff and the hotel is situated in the perfect location - especially if you like good quality food and drink, which we did. The breakfast, for just 10 Euros is well worth enjoying, especially if you have a busy day planned. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with some cool bars, shops & cafes on the door step. There is a Metro stop really close by and there are so good places to go running along the beaches or in a park that are both close to the hotel. The staff are friendly and efficient and the building is typically Spanish with stylish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality accommodation in the old town”
Reviews.Author: Otaview
Reviews.Content: In among the narrow streets of Barcelona's old town, and nestled next to many of the best restaurants and bars in the city, this hotel is a gem. You get to stay in an historic building that's hundreds of years old, yet it's tastefully done and very modern in its facilities. It feels safe there too (good locks, and every room has a safe) which is important in crime-ridden Barcelona. Great staff, a good breakfast (chargeable), and a high quality restaurant onsite too. Don't expect to park anywhere near, and you have to walk to a main road to get any transit or a taxi. There is WiFi but it's poor (as would be expected with those dense buildings and thick walls). However overall it's top quality accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a god location and price”
Reviews.Author: Jari_Kempele_Finland
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of nights in the hotel in Feb. The rooms are big and clean, location is very good and the staff is friendly. Pricelevel is also good, about 80 €/night. I guess the person/company who booked the room for me had some extra price for it.... I hear that all the rooms are different but did not check, anyway, mine was good, althoug the view from the window was to the next building, about 5 m from the window ;( There is a restaurant downstairs that seemed to be good 'cause it was crowded both evenings. I went to the tapas restaurant on the same street (recommend by TripAdvisor 2011) to have lunch and also tapas in the evening. I can also recommend that one, very nice restaurant with good food and resonable prices. I think it was called Tapas de Tapas or something. They have a Tripadvisor logo on the door so it is easy to find;) Lunch with a soop, paella and a glas of wine was about 10 €!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal!”
Reviews.Author: ThaisOReilly
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and very nice hotel. Breakfast is fine but the restaurant for dinner downstairs you can't miss. There is a fridge in every floor with free bottles of water for guest, which is great. The neighboorhood is awesome, filled with tapa bars and restaurants. I would definitelly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: beautiful clean hotel with a charming and friendly staff. We thought the location was hard to beat - close to beaches, ramblas, and shopping. Great dining abounds!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: veve2908
Reviews.Content: Good location (Born) just some meters from metro station Jaume and only 15 minutes walk to Portal del Angel (shopping street) 20 minutes walk to Plaza Catalunya and 10 minutes walk to the port. El Born is full of little Tapas places, Bars and good Restaurants as well as little, beautiful and unique shops. I like this area a lot though you must be careful of pickpockets. But nowadays they are everywhere and in every city.... The Hotel is small but very nice, the rooms are ok in size, nice deco and bathroom is modern. Everything is quite new and modern and very clean. There is no minibar but a fridge with as much mineral water with and without gas as you want and it is free of charge. The price is very decent for Barcelona, reason why the hotel is always fully booked and you should send your request early enough. I go often to Barcelona and this is my favorite 3*Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want sleep and quite then stay away from this place.”
Reviews.Author: henry56
Reviews.Content: This verry noise place and 3 floor rooms are dark, you dont know when is a day and night.you will hear from outseid verry loud music and sound of peoples are shouting.but the rooms are verry clean .keeped verry clean.at the end you will feel you are living in bunker,and they have a internet but it dosent work,not possible.they have two hotel house and boh of them same noise and dark.The unfriendly sevice by the recepcionthe rooms are verry expensive.if you want have good sleep and quite then better get 5 floor rooms otherweis you will not able to handle with noise.dont ask them taxi to airport,it will cost also more money. Be care full If you are in the metro in L4 gracia, they trayed to steal my pocket ! and also james1 ! if you traveling to barcelona pleace credit card and never take valuble things with you or put in the safe box.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TraLonW
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Rooms are small and the "four poster" frame around the beds encroach on valuable floor space. Bathroom clean and toiletries replenished every day. Good buffet breakfast but very rude staff in the breakfast room. Subway is very close by and good selection of bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Eda P
Reviews.Content: If you want a quite weekend away stay away from this Hotel. It's very noisy both during the day and night. The bathrooms are very dirty and the staff very rude. Location is the worst, 2 of our staff members got mugged and pick pocketed on that street within 2 hours of arriving at the hotel. Upon departure one of the guests forgot a shirt on the wardrobe.We emailed the hotel to see if it could be returned and didn't get a reply, after chasing it a couple of time their reply was: "as told you we are doing our best"....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: RelocCol
Reviews.Content: Loved it here, great price, adorable single room, loved that's surrounded by narrow streets, so much to explore from here and Tappas bar's everywhere. Very safe for single female traveller. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chipshopfred
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the old town, the metro is just up the street which has an excellent service with trains every few minutes. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is quite dark but very pleasant, with free water, apples and a safe in the room. The breakfast was excellent and kept us going til mid afternoon. The bed was a bit on the hard side for us and it was noisy during the night, would suggest asking for a back room if your a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cheezpirate
Reviews.Content: We stayed one of the suites at Banys Oriental for 2 nights. The room was huge with 30 foot ceilings and old world charm. However, for 2 people, it was a bit too big. I would have preferred a bathtub and a real king sized bed (vs 2 doubles put together) instead of the loft area, which we never used. It probably would have been great for a family with children. You could tell the room was due for some minor renovation. Not that anything was broken, but the the floors could have been fixed up and and bathroom upgraded. The best part was our suite was in the center of the building, so it was very quiet. The street is very loud at night, so I couldn't imagine having spent the night in a street facing room. Overall, it was a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can literally walk everywhere from this location”
Reviews.Author: spin101
Reviews.Content: The Banys Orientals is a fantastic location in Barcelona with very friendly and helpful staff, although there are no oriental themes. The free apples are a nice touch as are the two computers on the first floor (although the wifi failed to work unless you were literally on top of the reception desk in the foyer when I was there).The surrounding ancient streets are a great area to ramble around, even if ladies are all phobic of their handbags being stolen, and there are lots of nearby cafes with special offers. You can literally walk everywhere from this location. The rooms were adequate, clean and comfortbale, although not huge. Check out the organic restuarant around the corner (Origens C/ Vidrieria, 6, 08003).

Reviews.Title: “Greaat Hotel with Caveats”
Reviews.Author: Jerry6305
Reviews.Content: The Banys Orientals is in a great location, reasonable value, and a very helpful staff. Our room, which we were told was one of the rooms with lots of light, was very dark and small. Next time we'll bring a coal miner's headlamp. They advertise WiFi in every room. Our experience with our iPhones did not meet our expectations. We had to go to the common areas to get a signal. We were told if we had a computer they could provide a cable for access; but, that isn't WiFi. Still, our overall experience was very good largely because of the location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Toronto2001
Reviews.Content: Great location and very comfortable hotel. I had a single room. Very tiny but it had everthing I needed. I walked to the airport bus station about 15 minute walk with no problem even carrying luggage. Breakfast was good, with all kinds of extras [eg pine nuts] Dinner at the adjoining restaurant Senyor Pareuada - excellent and not overly expensive. Veal cheeks and pear and gazpacho. The hotel makes up for the small rooms by also providing all kinds of extras. Refirgerator in hall with bottles of water and bowls of apples for the guests to help themselves. Extra items beyond shampoo and soap provided.

Reviews.Title: “september 2011”
Reviews.Author: Svesa
Reviews.Content: Seconc time in Banys. Suite. Simply great. Can't be better. Best area in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Advisor-AAA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banys Orientals for 3 nights in September. The hotel was in the prefect location close to everything. Very friendly staf. We stayed in a suite what I wouldn't reccomend. Just stay at the normal rooms. Also 2 beds instead of one king bed, zo that was a bit disappointing....

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: JVW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banys Orientals for 3 nights in September, thanks to TripAdvisor recommendations. The hotel was in the prefect LOCATION close to metro, beach, the Gothic quarters, great restaurants, night life and shopping. Very friendly staff and I loved the decor.... We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Have recommended to many”
Reviews.Author: oriordanm
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend who was away on a girly holiday, I was on a romantic holiday. The location was unbelievable and our room was amazing, so crisp and clean. The room itself was a tiny bit small but the big 4 poster bed was worth it. I have recommended this hotel to many, couples and girly holidays. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment in the food, so many nice restaurants just a short walk away. Would defintitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel: beautiful contemporary decor, helpful staff, ideal location. Small rooms, but excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: celiafc
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. Staying at this hotel was a delightful experience. The guests were young, mostly European and attractive, all adding to the ambiance. The neighborhood is marvelous, recently "upscale and still a little rough. Hold onto your purse!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful extension... without lift”
Reviews.Author: GreeceVang
Reviews.Content: I always tried to check if Banys Orientals has available rooms when I travel (with my spouse) to Barcelona... And I am never disappointed until now... Last time I got (was it a kind of upgrade?) a huge room in the "extension" of the hotel some 30 maters away in the same street. It was a hot period in Barcelona. The fact we were in the last floor (3rd) without a lift (even only for the luggage) was the only negative part. But... I will continue to check the possibility to go there, despite this problem!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Pineconesandfreesias Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a stylish break for us. In the perfect location, close to a neighbourhood of quirky shops and bars, it had comfortable rooms with free internet and bottles of chilled mineral water. Reception staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, and we loved the little touches, like the goody bag. The Banys was recommended by friends from New Zealand and it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Benny L
Reviews.Content: With two kids, we had to take a suite, outside the main the hotel. The suite was very spacious and lovely, and included small treats we did not expect to get in a 3-stars hotel. It was not clear that the water in the minibar are free of charge (great for August heat). Internet was not usable in the room (wifi or wire) - they said a techie checked and he said it was ok. That was it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our Barca Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: (Stayed in July 2010, not September 2010) My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights or so, and our holiday in Barcelona was made so much more enjoyable thanks to this hotel. Pros: - Location. It's near a metro stop, so it's easy to arrive and depart. It's also very easy to get to other attractions through the metro stop, or by walking. At the same time, it's just out of the main party areas so there isn't much noise the whole night keeping you awake. - Service. The management was easy to deal with before arrival, and during our stay. They helped plan the best departure time to get to the airport, and recommended some fantastic restaurants (instead of being recommended whoever has left a flyer at the hotel). - Comfort. I'm not too picky with hotel rooms, so I'll just say that it was clean, comfortable, and everything worked that I needed (not sure about TV/Internet, etc). There was also an unlimited supply of bottled water for anyone to use, which is extremely helpful for a summer holiday in Barca. I wish more hotels did this! Cons: None really. It's only that the price matches the quality you get, and it's hard to book in the high season (we tried again this year without success).

Reviews.Title: “We will be back to Banys”
Reviews.Author: Dries G
Reviews.Content: Right in the center, not far away from the beach, Gaudi, metro, etc ...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: IENF
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel Banys Orientals twice now, and we'll definately be back! It's reasonably priced (but beware that the prices are not including VAT) and we love the area! It's a 5min walk to the harbour, 10min to the beach and most of the sights in the historic centre is easily accesable. We ate at plenty of great restaurants only a few min walk away- Cal Pep(one of the most well-known tapas bars in Barcelona), Senyor Paradella (in the same building as the hotel), Taller de Tapas, Celler de la Ribera.. The metro station Jaume 1 is just right up the street. The breakfast is a bit pricy (10E/pers) but very good. (But we usually ate at a coffee place in v/Laietana. ) There's free internet and free bottled water in refrigerators on every floor. The interior is beautiful, the rooms and bathroom are of a decent size, there's a safe deposit box in every room. And there's even slippers, toothbrushes and hairbrushes in the room. Although the walls are very thin, so you can hear a lot of what's going on in the neighbouring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just lucked into this hotel”
Reviews.Author: caldispatcher
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a room for a couple of nights and so called this hotel. The prices were almost have of the room we were staying in and the service was so much better. The 2nd night stay they didn't have their regular room and so we stayed in the suite (more like a small apartment for about 30 euros more. The regular room had 2 beds and the bath...the suite had a king downstairs, a loft with a single upstairs..bath is upstair. There was also a mini fridge and armoir downstairs. The service was awesome. Food in their restaurant wasn't 5 star but it was good!!! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!! (We were here in October 2009)

Reviews.Title: “very good choice, great location and groovy place”
Reviews.Author: Frankie098
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in fab location with heaps of groovy eating places around and the metro 2mn walk away. Low points: staff had a bit of an attitude and we are still puzzled at having to eat breakfast in almost total darkness (...???...). The room was a good size, groovy and not so noisy even though facing the street (4or 5th floor mind you). Again, v. low lights in the room and bathroom so get your torch ready if you are into precision make-up ! Nice touch free bottled water con y sin gas on each floor. The restaurant downstairs seemed very nice but the choice outside was too appealling to resist. All and all still great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MissSydney
Reviews.Content: Second time visit - I can't fault this hotel for its location and value. It is fantastic value for money - you do not need to spend anymore to feel safe, happy and well looked after The rooms are still the same as 5 years ago, but they got it right the first time, and design wise still looking good Free WIFI, water, apples...and so many bars and food spots just outside the door. El born is around the corner, all the hip designer shops are there too, the Catedral is up around the corner, the beach down the road...and be sure to jump on the bus and see all of Gaudi's wonders.......ah Barcelona...I miss you!

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Molly255072
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Banys on friend's reommendation. Great position and lovely boutique hotel. Had room on top floor which was a bit noisy as we could hear people in next room. Floors were timber and they also were noisy. However, we were hardly in our room as there is so much to see and do in Barcelona. The staff were very helpful and the restaurant at the hotel was fantastic and always seemed to be busy.

Reviews.Title: “Such great value in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: gotyourback
Reviews.Content: This hotel combines the most amazing location with amazing service. But the most amazing thing is the value. We stayed in several places in barcelona and by far this one is the best value. You wont' find a better combination. Book early and often!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get what you book.”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller4
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel in March. A double and twin. We were advised the week before we arrived that we were being relocated into two separate buildings away from the hotel. Too late to make any other arrangements we accepted this change. When we arrived we were shown to our rooms which were just up the street but were only accessible by stairs - 3 flights of stairs, which with 6 bags was a hassle. The rooms had only twin beds which was disappointing and wi fi was only accessible from one room. Overall if we had known well beforehand we weren't going to get what we had booked we would have gone elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitzbenedict
Reviews.Content: The Banys Orientals has a perfect location near the underground Jaume I and in the middle of the old town. So, for the location, nothing could be better. However, if you do not take a suite, the rooms are quite small and dark. It was hard getting around in the room, since they had put in too much furniture. I did not understand why, but I could never use the Internet on my computer (too thick walls?). An advantage is the mineral water you get for free, but on the other hand, it is quite cheap in Spain. The breakfast was quite authentic with nice varieties of ham and cheese. But unfortunately, it was quite dark in the restaurant, so you did not have the impression that it was broad daylight... The staff could be more attentive. We went back in the evening to get our suitcases to take the boat to Palma and left the hotel about 10 PM. My partner had not discovered that he had forgot his wallet in the room by that time, but I think that someone in the reception could have set up a sign saying that they had found a wallet in one of the roomes. Now, the wallet is sent to us to a cost of 35 euros...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the location”
Reviews.Author: emilyDC
Reviews.Content: I traveled with two friends to Barcelona in June and loved Hotel Banys. We stayed in the suites down the block from the actual hotel. They were clean, comfortable, and spacious. The hotel also gave free water, fruit, and internet. In addition to being a great hotel the location was amazing. We could walk everywhere (beach, Las Ramblas, Placa de Catalunya, and Passeig de Gràcia) . We were also surrounded by good food and places to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: katecharland
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Banys Orientals was an excellent experience. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated and the hotel was in an amazing location. Our room was on the street side and was a bit loud at night - but were were in Barcelona for it's lively culture so it did not bother us. (bring ear plugs though if you need quiet to sleep) We loved the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “be careful!”
Reviews.Author: fireyarieslips
Reviews.Content: bed bug alert! this was my first trip to barcelona. the city, sights, and food were awesome! i loved this hotel because it's cute, affordable, and central to touristy sights. the staff was really helpful and friendly. however, the 4th floor has bed bugs. i was in two different rooms and bitten several times throughout the week i was there in both rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable elegance in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: CharlestownWanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple and charming with a location that can't be beat. Nestled on a vibrant pedestrian pathway (no cars), we could have spent hours people-watching from our perch on the sultry balcony. The neighborhood, Born-Ribera, is a feast for the eyes as you wind through the labyrinth and move through enticing bars, restaurants, and shops. We felt at home and enjoyed the warm and relaxed elegance of the hotel. The staff reciprocates polite behavior. We'll stay again as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Actual value for money in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: SlicedTomato
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Banys Oriental has a few really good things going for it. It's in the centre of the El Born district, in walking distance to everywhere. And its rooms are larger than average European hotel rooms (though from what I've seen on TripAdvisor they would still be smaller than American travellers might expect.) Our bed was comfy, the room spotless and the bathroom big and well appointed. Unbelievably good value for Barcelona. Our one warning is regarding bookings. We booked over the phone, only to arrive and find our booking had been made a year into the future! We still got a room and later, while chatting with a French couple over dinner in the restaurant downstairs, they told us they stay there every year and always book their room a year out to make sure they get one, so it was not such a surprise that the hotel thought we wanted a 2012 booking. The staff helped as they could and booked us a hotel for the night they couldn't accommodate us (a more expensive place, but they negotiated it so we could pay their room rate.) As a plus, the hotel's restaurant specialises in Catalonian food and our food there was excellent - we actually ate there twice, which is very unusual for us.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: wahroonga1
Reviews.Content: My wife & I visited Barcelona for the first time & stayed in this great boutique hotel where the staff, room, breakfast and location were excellent. It is ideally located in the historic area within easy walking to all the city's highlights Provided free internet, bottled water 7 myself visited Barcelona for the first time in May 2011 We stayed at this lovely boutique hotel upon a glowing recommendation from a local travel agent All aspects of the hotel were stunning: the room, the staff, the breakfast and the location which is within the historic area with easy walking access to

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: LilianaKostova
Reviews.Content: A first trip to a new destination can be a bit overwhelming and go wrong on so many levels, so needless to say when looking for a hotel in Barcelona I was a bit nervous and asked a friend for recommendations. She suggested Hotel Banys Orientals for it's prime location and unbeatable rates, and very happy she did so. I later found out that the staff is professional, super helpful and really friendly; the rooms are really cute and the cleaning staff takes pride in the quality of their services. Whether you visit Barcelona for a night or two weeks Hotel Banys Orientals is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Banys only made our trip better!”
Reviews.Author: Ais23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banys Orientals for 3 nights in May. We stayed in room 203. It was a smaller room, but our bathroom was great. Huge shower, great water pressure, and a separate toilet room. The air conditioning worked, but only if the floor to ceiling windows were closed - so eco aware! There was a safe and a large wardrobe for hanging. The only problem was that due to the location of our room, we only got wifi in the bathroom. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. The last day of our stay our flight was cancelled and the staff at reception booked us back into the hotel, helped us call our airline and insurance company (at least 5 different international numbers), and they did it while not making us feel like we were a burden. And when we arrived before our room was ready we were told we would change in the bathrooms, use the free internet, and take advantage of the free water. They also stored our bags securely before we checked in and after we checked out. The location was perfect. So so easy to get to from the airport if you are taking the aerobus and right in the middle of the Old City. The Juame 1 metro station was 100 meters from the hotel, 5 minute walk from The Picasso Museum and Santa Maria del Mar was 2 blocks away. There was great nightlife in our area, locals and tourists alike wandering around the streets and having tapas and drinks. Only 10-15minutes walk to La Rambla, 20 minute walk to beach, 5 minute walk to Port Vell, and only a 5 minute walk to the Hop on/off bus tour stop. Banys also provides free water in refrigerators on each floor. We took huge advantage of this - would have paid a fortune for water otherwise! It was such a nice bonus! We could not recommend Banys Orientals more. A great place to explore Barcelona from.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: arsho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Banys for 3 nights in May 2011 with my wife and 5 yo son.We had a suite near to the main building,very spacious and comfortable.The location is perfect,close to Ramblas,zoo,barcelonetta,aquarium,pl.Catalunya and metro station.The guys at reception desk were very helpful and kind,breakfast was good except from service (there was only 1 waiter serving many tables).There was free internet but never could connect with my i phone.We liked it very much and we'll stay again next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Svesa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the suites for 4 nights in June 2010. Fantastic room, and in all senses a terrific stay. Have already booked for September 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lateralus_59
Reviews.Content: We booked for three nights after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and found the previous reviews to be pretty much spot-on. We requested a quiet room and were given a room at the back of the hotel on the first floor. The room was small but clean and perfectly adeqate as a base from which to explore the city. The bed was large and comfortable. the bathroom was adequate with an excellent shower, although a little dark. Complementary toiletries were provided, as well as bottled water (from the fridge on the first floor) and free access to internet via a couple of desktop PCs in the public areas. Location was pretty much perfect for us, - just 50m from the metro and about 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas, the Cathedral and other sights. Plenty of local bars, restaurants and Tapas. There was some noise in the morning from external construction work but this was outside the control of the hotel. We ate once in the attached restaurant which was good value for money. Overall the hotel offers good value for money and deserving of its rating on Tripadvisor. We would be happy to stay there again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfect for three”
Reviews.Author: NJfam3
Reviews.Content: Our family of three has experienced various types of rooms in Europe but the Hotel Banys Orientals suite was remarkably spacious. The suites are located fifty feet or so from the hotel entrance so we almost felt as though we had an apartment with all the amenities of a hotel. Our daughter had her own small loft just above our bedroom It was also very conveniently located for most of the attractions of Barcelona either by walking or by using the nearby metro station. The amenities included easily accessed WiFi(slower speeds than we are used to but more than enough for browsing the web) and free bottles of water and fruit. Overall an experience we would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2275
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the positive reviews from Tripadvisor and weren't disappointed. Very affordable boutique hotel in a great location. Clean, good size rooms. Free bottled water and fruit. The hotel was a bit noisy (restaurants close by and construction) but otherwise good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DavidBracknell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent located close to the Ramblas, many very good restaurants and the metro. Although the rooms are a little small, they are very clean and provide good value for many. The staff are friendly (like most people in Barcelona). Overall, a great city made more enjoyable by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of all the gothic quarter”
Reviews.Author: Droopydrawrs52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 4 days here .We loved the hotel ,the rooms whilst small were great and white cotton bedding and clean rooms. Lots of little touches like toilet bags and things you may of fprgotten. The staff were very helpful and gave us lots of help with places to eat and things to see. Very good value

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay, come back every year”
Reviews.Author: DS64
Reviews.Content: Trendy, clean, WiFi, good location, friendly staff, no complaints other than local noise which is typical for Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected excellence in so many ways !”
Reviews.Author: YamCM
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week holiday in Barcelona and our French friend has recommended us HBO. Initially we thought it was just another hotel but it sure turned out to be an excellent hotel with very strategic locality to many tourist spots within walking distance. We also find the restaurant within the hotel to be an excellent recommendation with nice food with affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: bogiesdad
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the hotel both times staying in the suites a few blocks from the hotel. We were there 3 years ago and enjoyed the hotel so much we went back again. Wonderful staff and the suite rooms are quite large. Very quiet and yet centrally located so you can walk everywhere. No more than a 10 minute walk to the Rambla yet you are in a wonderful neighborhood with lots of restaurants and tapas bars. We are looking forward to our next visit to Barcelona and we would certainly return to the Banys Orientals.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: krebbel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the only that's wearth its price

Reviews.Title: “Charming but with problems”
Reviews.Author: JulieASC
Reviews.Content: The rooms are airy and beautiful, clean and simply decorated. The restaurant beneath the hotel is fantastic. We ate there several times over the course of the trip. The downside to having such a great restaurant under the hotel is that there was pretty substantial noise all night--people talking, waitstaff yelling, bottles being thrown out, etc. Plus, someone got mugged in the alley behind the hotel. The amount of noise was impressive, but that's what you get in a city. The real problem was the mustiness of the bathroom. Although it was a good-looking bathroom, there was no ventilation, and subsequently there was mold, mildew, or a combination growing behind the walls or in places I couldn't see. But man, oh, man, could we smell it! After a few days of the exposure, I was unable to sleep due to a severe allergy flare up. As a positive, they give free bottled water to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple and clean hotel at a very good rate”
Reviews.Author: CesarAlonso
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the old city, surrounded by bars and little shops, very nice place at a very reasonable rates, huge rooms clean and with all the services. Breakfast a bit disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jdorosz
Reviews.Content: If you think this bargain boutique hotel in the Born is too good to be true, you're right, it is. The suite we stayed in was roomy but poorly appointed, cold at night with only one blanket provided, the beds too hard, the WiFi never worked, it was noisy day and night and the bathroom was worn out and grimy. After we had checked out we realised that we had absent-mindedly left behind a couple of items of shopping in our room; although we were assured that these would be promptly shipped to us to the UK, they never were. After sending the management repeated emails asking what had happened to these items I only got any kind of response when I told them I was going to write them up on Trip Advisor if they didn't offer me some sort of explanation. Then all they did was strenuously assure me that they only had their guests best interests at heart, but they couldn't produce our shopping and they didn't make any attempt to make it right. A very low rent attitude from a low rent outfit indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a beautiful room in the Born.”
Reviews.Author: kritschgau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Banys Oriental in the Born district in Barcelona in November with my husband and some friends. It was a terrific experience! The rate was great for the high quality of the hotel and the incredible location. It is just off a main road, but far enough that it is quiet at night. In the middle of the tangles streets of the Born district with terrific restaurants, shops, pinotxo bars and really close to the Picasso Museum. The rooms are clean and decent sized with a comfortable bed and internet available. Bathrooms are beautiful, and the front desk folks are very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik_1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suites five minutes walk from the hotel. Very nice and spacious. Hotel staf very friendly and helpful to all kinds of questions and directions we had. Would highly recommend it, but I think we're settling with the regular rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Zinnia25
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. This hotel recommended in Lonely Planet guide book so we requested 2 suites. On arrival at hotel taken to our suites in a different building close-by in a dodgy looking alleyway. Suites were accessed by one entrance with good security but once in the building the lighting was inadequate. Dangerous on the stairs. The rooms were spacious but it would have been nice to have had tea and coffee facilities. Breakfast was extra and we walked to the main hotel for this. It was plentiful and a good variety. Staff at main reception friendly but one breakfast staff not so.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmr79
Reviews.Content: We opted for a "suite" which was in a separate building a short walk from the main hotel and it was perfect for what we needed. The room was very spacious, much larger than any of the other rooms I have stayed in in Spain. Front desk staff were nice and helpful when our luggage arrived late and again when we had to have our rail passes that we forgot fedex'd to us overnight. The location was great, walking distance to many sights, restaurants, bars, and very close to the subway too. Free wi-fi was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, run down, bad service but good for price and location”
Reviews.Author: AllanBLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel - very nice design Rooms - nice design and very well equipped. Free bottled water and WIFI. However, way to small and really tired, The bathroom was mouldy and the shower was broken, Flooring coming up. Service - awful. Everything too much trouble. I was even refused the loan of a pen. Location - fantastic. In the middle of everything. Value - despite the above problems, the hotel is good value at 99 euro

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lawyers-from-Leeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite a find - it is very central and located in the lively Born district. Very good value for what you get. The hotel itself quite small but the rooms are clean and functional - the whole place has a "boutique" feel to it. Free bottles of mineral water and apples on the landings are a nice touch. The location on a busy pedestrian street means that some rooms can be noisy until late at night - a lesser evil compared with the traffic noise on many other Barcelona streets. There is no problem finding somewhre to eat or drink nearby - within a five minute walk you are spoilt for choice. Try Bar Bubo in the Placa Santa Maria del Mar, right opposite the cathedral, for a drink and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed..”
Reviews.Author: Curtsey123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banys Orientals for 2 nights, we were allocated a room at the back of the building. It was fairly small, but had everything needed, including free safety box, flat screen tv, comfortable bed, good shower and bathroom. It is in a good location, within 2 minutes of the metro and only a 10 minute or so walk from Plaza Catalunya where the airport bus drops off. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and the bonus of free bottled water and fruit on each floor was welcomed. We found it a great location to explore Barcelona. Walking distance to the port/beach area and also to the Ramblas. Overall a great place to stay in Barcelona. They were completely full when we stayed, as I'm sure they are most days, hence why they do not have the need for online booking. Very easy to book via email though. I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TravelustNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Banys Orientals w/ my wife and young children (ages btw 2 - 6) in August. We stayed in one of the Annex Suites in a building right next to the hotel. It was a very large room w/ two double beds downstairs and another bed in the loft upstairs. It was very roomy and clean w/ a large modern bathroom and was perfect for the whole family. Although we were in the Annex the room was immaculately maintained by the staff and we were only about 10 meters from the front desk. And for Barcelona it was a great deal at 130 Euros a night. Besides really liking the hotel itself, one of best aspects of it is the location in the heart of El Born neighborhood. Its on a nice quiet pedestrian street lined w/ great restaurants and a very short walk to the historic Santa Maria del Mar church. We ate at Taller de Tapas twice (our trip also included La Rioja, Asturias - where my wife is from and Segovia before flying out Madrid) and it was our favorite tapas place in all of Spain. We also had dinner at Senyor Parellada for classic filling Catalan cuisine, which was an amazing meal and amazingly cheap for the quality, portions and fine dining service. Besides the immediate neighborhood the hotel is basically a ten minute walk or less to the Catedral, La Rambla, La Boqueria Market, the waterfront / Aquarium and the Parque Ciutadella and Barcelona Zoo. Our children really loved all of these attractions (OK, maybe not the cathedral so much...) which made the hotel a great location for families. And besides that it was an easy few stop metro (located a 1/2 block from the hotel) to La Sagrada Familia, again making it very convenient for most of the main tourist attractions. Speaking of the metro though... while on it we were one of the many tourists in Barca who get pick pocketed and basically were targeted b/c of the kids. Although this was a very frustrating afternoon the front desk (and Camilla in particular) were EXCELLENT in helping us deal w/ our credit cards, get a police report and most importantly contacting the Motor Vehicle Dept in the US to receive a faxed abstract of my DL so I could still rent a car and continue on w/ our journey across Spain. They really went above and beyond what would be expected and for that I am still grateful. So although we loved the hotel anyway due to the Annex Suite and great location in El Born, it was the service provided during this stressful moment that both helped salvage our trip and prompted me to share my experience and strongly recommend their establishment. I hope you don't encounter what we did but if so rest assured that the hotel will go out of its way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong staying here if you want to be centrally located in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mbay2002
Reviews.Content: This is a 3-star hotel that is just beautiful and located close to everything! I would definitely stay here again, and definitely recommend to others. I'm glad I booked in advance because once I arrived and checked-in, I found that they were completely booked. I was traveling solo, and booked a single room for the first two nights. The single room was small (the bathroom was almost as large as the sleeping area!). My third night I transferred to a double room which was really much more spacious, but of course a bit more expensive. There is internet and A/C in the room, it's very comfortable, and very quiet. There is also a restaurant on-site, but I did not try it. The location cannot be beat... it is right smack in the middle of everthing in the central part of downtown, maybe a 10-15 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya, 10 minutes to Las Ramblas, and a minute or two to all the wonderful tapas bars. The staff here is absolutely fantastic. I can't think of anything negative about this place - except it would be nice if the price were a bit lower but hey, this is Barcelona so you're going to pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, the suite unsuitable dark/musty bathroom mouldy not nice.”
Reviews.Author: Jack187497
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Suite they put us in is away from the Hotel itself, has no lift and the stairs are not suitable for seniors, myself, husband & mature daughter had two flights of steps, my older brother in law and his wife had 4 flights of steps to conquer, a challenge you might say, a virtual nightmare i would say as it has not much lighting and the suites although quite large were dark inside and the bathrooms were extremely dark/musty and mouldy. We were extremely disappointed as when we made a complaint to change rooms no feed back was given, we then requested to view the rooms in the real part of the hotel, they had at least a lift and the room shown is the one on the internet site not the ones we were put in. The location is very good though and near the barri gotic the port and not far from La Rambla no complaints re the location. If booking this hotel please request the rooms where the lift is located or if you can find another Hotel book that one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ealexandra
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Banys Orientals. Its a stylish hotel in a great neighborhood that's perfect for exploring Barcelona. Only two minor drawbacks worth mentioning: (1) ht even with a room on the back, its can be pretty loud with the noise from the street; (2) from time the wi-fi would go out.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: larsiversen69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banys on our honeymoon this August. We had one of the suites, which lay about 50m from the reception. The room was large with stairs leading to a kind of second floor. In some of the other rewiews people have made remarks about noise from the street, especially if the room faces l'argenteria street. There is a lot of pedestrians walking this street in the evening, and there is a lot of citysounds if the windows are open. This did not bother us at all, and when there was time for sleep the balcony doors where sufficiently soundisolated. The location is very good in the heart of the old town. 20min walk to the beach, 10min to the shoppingstreet, a lot of good restaurants just down the street. We recomend Taverna de Cobra, great tapas. Estruch right outside Barcelona Cathedral has great lunches. + free water each day i the refridgerator balcony - very low pressure in the shower no wireless network(but cable can be provided in the reception) breakfast should be included PS. visit Aire de Barcelona for a very nice spatreatment. The touristguides does not mention it but we recomend it. Be sure to book in good time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and staff atitude - there are many better hotels in Barcelona!"”
Reviews.Author: IvoKlotins
Reviews.Content: Although I found this hotel as recommended by Conde Nast Travaler magazine in 2006, I would strongly advise not to stay there. I guess a lot has changed since 2006. Upon our arrival we were treated with great disprespect by the reception staff, they were trying to make us pay for one extra bed although the previous arrangments were made months before. Upon my notice that we had already agreed upon everything before, Mr. Juan Pablo at the reception explained that he has arrived at 3:00 PM that day and he does not care about my arranagments. In the meantime Mrs. Emelie from the reception was just smiling at our conversation and considered everything to be a good joke. There was no one on the duty responsible that evening, so we could not really speak to anybody else. The manager's name was declined to us. The best part happened when we tried to check out - there was an attempt to charge us double price presuming we had not paid1/2 for the hotel before. Again we needed to enter into discussions and prove our point. So, my advise is to avoid this hotel if you want a stay without arguing to the staff. Also about safety - the rooms can be accessed throught the balconies from the street. The sign on the balcony's door says - please close when out of room and while sleeping for your own safety. One day when we came back to the room after being away for the whole day, the balcony's door was wide open since the cleaner had opened it and forgotten to close it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: mahoneya
Reviews.Content: On our recent honeymoon to Spain, Barcelona was our first stop. We wanted a reasonably priced, well situated, safe place to stay to help us discover all the city's charms, and Hotel Banys Orientals could not have been a better choice! The location is great. There are hip shops and restaurants right outside the door, but the side street on which the Hotel is located does not create a lot of street noise. You are incredibly close to a Metro Stop and also within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and many other attractions including a short walk to the beach! One of our favorite things to do was to walk outside and get lost in the charming streets of the Gothic neigborhood. Unlike the more hectic sections of the city, we never felt unsafe in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations and any questions that we had. The fridge full of free water (both with and without gas) and the free internet were also nice bonuses! Although on the smaller side, our corner room was not as small as some of the rooms we had seen in Spain and it also allowed us privacy. It was clean and comfortable. We enthusiastically recommend both the city of Barcelona and this hotel as a base within its charms. Buen viaje!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - fine hotel - very good value”
Reviews.Author: chinchok
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days in June, concerned by earlier reviews mentioning noise. In city-centre Spain it will never be silent, but noise levels for my room opening onto alley at side of hotel were acceptable. Rooms small but perfectly formed and very well kept. Internet functioned well and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Restaurant on ground floor has very good food at reasonable prices. Very good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Finally value for money in a city!!”
Reviews.Author: ambassadorger
Reviews.Content: The Banys Orientals is a beautiful hotel right in the heart of Barcelona. After a bus ride from the airport you arrive at the hotel which lies in a small side street where no cars can go. The reception is tiny yet entering the building towards the back the true beauty unfolds. A classic restaurant with balconies above your head. A mellow lighting complements the entire look perfectly. The rooms are modern and very comfortable. Plenty of space for suitcases and clothes. The bathroom is also very nice and I was positively surprised about the little welcome present. My next trip to Barcelona will certainly take me there again.

Reviews.Title: “all you want and need in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EllenQ
Reviews.Content: Banys Oriental is first of all in an absolutely perfect spot of Barcelona. Ive been to Barcelona before and this area is really where to stay. It is very good value for the money - clean, lovely architecture and very stylish decorated - Very nice bathroom and very comfortable beds. Complimentary waters and apples added to the great stay. What you see on ther wep page is really what you get. Some has written that the rooms are a bit small - I don't know what they compare to, being in the middle of an european city and being a 3 star hotel I found the room normal size, not small at all. I've heard it can be noice from the street - I am not surprised, there are lots of businesses and restaurants on the street. We requested a quiet room and had the best sleep in a long time. We didnt have a balcony but that was fine for us. Breakfast is more than great. Here as well you really get your money worth. We only had breakfast once though - there are som many cafés and restaurnants in the neighbourhood that need to be discoverd. = ) Only bad thing is that the breakfast room was a bit dark. We paid around 100 euro a night and I consider that a very resonable price for this lovely hotel. I will be back = )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KBP-in-SY
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night break in Barcelona. We stayed at the Hotel Banys Orientals and loved it. The rooms were very clean, minimalistic and the shower powerful and refreshing. After reading other comments about noise etc. I emailed the hotel and asked for a room on the top floor away from any obvious sources of noise. I was not disappointed. The walls are not the thickest but apart from the occasional sound of conversation next door we were not troubled. The beds were comfortable and we slept really well. We did have long, busy days though. We decided to take breakfast in the hotel and there was always plenty of choice with staff refilling empty dishes efficiently. We were set for the day after eating. The staff at reception were very friendly with welcoming 'Holas' every time we passed through reception. They quickly answered our questions and phoned several of the churches to supply us with a very comprehensive list of mass times. They also gave us some good shopping tips. The location is very central with many nice bars, restaurants and shops close by. I would certainly think about booking this hotel if I was to return to Barcelona in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but..............”
Reviews.Author: JasperJohnson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Barcelona for 4 nights in April 2010. Firstly, the location is simply brilliant, right in the heart of El Born and the Old City. The building is beautiful, the staff are wonderful and the food in the attached restaurant was delicious and authentic. I recommend the Oxtail, and the Anchovies with bread. Great olives served up in paper cones and divine wines. The restaurant looks and feels like a Michelin starred restaurant. OK, so here come the cons. Noise. We were staying in one of the suites which are located in a building further down the street. Our room overlooked the street. Firstly, it was very noisy, Argentera is a main pedestrian thoroughfare and our first night (a Saturday) was spent awake until 6am when the church bells rang out. There was loud singing and shouting from revellers, it sounded like a carnival out there! The hotel cannot be held responsible for this but it would be sensible to insulate the windows better. Light. The buildings are old, in those days they built buildings in Spain to be tall and close together to create some shelter from the fierce midday sun...as a result, the buildings are designed to be dark but the management need to provide better lighting, the lighting in the rooms from table lamps to reading lights etc was all wrong and generally not bright enough. We wanted to open the curtains fully to let in as much natural daylight as possible but couldn't because of the office building across the way and people looking in. It really did feel like a dark cave in there. Internet Access. There is wifi internet in the building but the base station emitting the signal is too far away from the suites we stayed in and we therefore couldn't get online. This was actually a fairly major thing for me as I needed to keep in touch with work stuff in case deadlines were missed and not being able to check emails from the room was a pain. Some simple and inexpensive changes would turn a good hotel into a great hotel. How difficult would it be to change the lightbulbs to be a brighter wattage, put a new router near the suites to increase the signal for internet and put in some double glazing? We would definitely go again but we would choose a room in the main hotel, higher up to get the maximum natural daylight. We cannot fault the staff who always greeted us a with a smile and a Hola and who helped as much as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: BostonBusi_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed while attending a conference. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although small. There were extra toiletries stocked in the room and even a pair of slippers; however, there was no clock and no refrigerator. Free WiFi in the rooms was slow, but functional. Breakfast provided a good variety of foods. The location of the hotel is excellent, with easy walking to public transportation, the Cathedral of Barcelona, many restaurants and shops. I would have rated this hotel more highly but the noise at night was a problem. I was often awakened around midnight by "dumpster" noises of emptying trash, breaking bottles, and slamming metal, as well as by loud talking of workers from a nearby restaurant. This lasted for at least an hour. The sound insulation of the rooms was not effective, either. I could hear my neighbour talking loudly at 2 a.m. and hallway traffic (with closing doors) was disturbing. So, if you are a very sound sleeper, or if you can get a room away from the alley and restaurant, this may be a good choice of place to stay. It is not the place to stay if you need quiet at night. I would recommend with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: electra005
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel during the summer and was not disappointed. I booked a suite because there were no regular rooms available. The suite was next door and had a separate entrance. The space was immaculate; very clean, modern, loft-like with exposed gothic beams. Free water (still & sparkling), apples, internet and huge comfortable bed. The location is excellent. A 10 minute walk from many tourist areas including Las Ramblas, Barceloneta, Picasso Museum, etc. and right next to a parking lot and the metro. There are only a few negative things that I can think of. One is that there was no elevator so my heavy luggage had to be carried up and down the stairs. The second is that the hotel is somewhat hidden and is hard to find. I didn't try the food so I can't comment on that. Overall, a very cool boutique hotel with helpful employees. I visit Barcelona every year and I'll definitely stay there again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location just request an upper floor.”
Reviews.Author: jbryan66
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint hotel in a great location! The rooms are very clean and comfortable. My favorite detail about the room were the floor to ceiling french doors that opened for me to look out in to the alley. I had a second floor room above the kitchen to the restaurant connected to the hotel. I heard a few pots and pans clang together and trash bags being thrown out. That lasted until about 2 am and then it was quite. Next time, I will request a room on a higher floor. The hotel is very convenient to the trains-up the road a half block and then cross the street. I'll be going back in Feb. 2010, so I'll let you know how that goes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mcginn88
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is minutes away from the metro in a good part of Barcelona. The rooms were comfortable, although a bit hard to find. The suites are in a totally different building on a different street, but secluded with an apartment like feel. The breakfast was not anything special, but the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - NOISY - had to leave at 2AM!”
Reviews.Author: Jsunset
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room for 2 nights just after Christmas after reading a great review in The Times of London Travel magazine. We were put in the handicapped room on the first floor. It was directly next to the kitchen staff doors. We were woken up at 1:30 in the morning with doors slamming and loud talking by the staff. This persisted and I went to the front desk to complain. Nothing could be done. Then the trash from the restaurant was being taken out at almost 2 in the morning directly under our room and outside the window. We could not sleep at all. We decided to leave the hotel in the middle of the night as this was insane. The front staff locked us in until I paid the bill for the night. We paid and went out find a hotel at 2 in the morning. This ruined our trip entirely. I have written to the hotel about this experience and no response 5 days later. Nothing. The worst thing is that this is where they put people who may have a handicap - that's terrible. We were able to pack our bags and leave, but not everybody can do that, especially in a wheelchair. Shame on them. This was the worst hotel experience anywhere in the world, ever. Do not give them your business.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MarcusB_roam
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel, lovely room, good restaurant and close to some great shops, bars and restaurants. A 10 minute walk from the Ramblas and other touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Plan to not sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Ravennarose96
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it – clean, comfortable rooms, nice extras – like high end toiletries and a great location. The free bottled water was a nice extra. Now we know we were in Barcelona and there would be street noise and that can be strangely pleasant – you feel like you’re part of the town you’re visiting but the walls in this hotel are so thin you hear everything and we do mean EVERYTHING that our neighbors were doing. In addition, the elevator makes a loud spaceship like noise throughout the night as people come and go. Reception was pleasant enough and there are plenty of great places to dine in the immediate area. One place that stood out was Tast – just a couple of doors down from the hotel on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: docframe
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to return to this gem of an hotel despite our less than complimentary review off the suites (external to the hotel). No hesitation in recommending this hotel unreservedly. Remains a great place to stay and retains all that impressed us the first time round many years ago - a rare achievement. Great location, great staff - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Right at Home at Banys”
Reviews.Author: FELTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suites for 4 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. It was great to have so much space and feel so at home - we felt we just had our own little flat in Barcelona. The suite was easily accessible and just a 2 minute walk from the main hotel and you could phone the hotel for any thing you needed. They cleaned our rooms each day and refilled our fridge with water, which was complimentary. They had wi-fi as well as computers for use. The location is perfect because you're not in the touristy hub-bub of Las Ramblas but only about 10-15 minute walk to it, if you want to see some of those sights. You're also just around the corner from one of the tourist bus stops, which was perfect for us to get oriented to the city. The staff was so helpful in getting our luggage in the room for us, they also assisted us in making reservations for dinner. The hotel is decorated in a very contemporary way and is lovely. They are also very close to the metro if you want to take it. The adorable cobblestone streets of El Born are lovely and filled with great restaurants, bars and shops. We also stayed in a regular room at the end of our trip (we took a 1 week cruise and stayed one night upon our return before flying home). The regular room was also nice but much smaller. I was glad we opted for more space for our longer stay, as we felt so at home and not cramped at all. We can't wait til our next trip to Barcelona and Banys.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: SJLTHereford
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an excellent location. We found our room to be a good size, spotlessly clean and well equiped. The room was looking out on to the street which was lovely in the daytime and evening but be aware that refuse trucks do come down here at night so if you think this might bother you, definately request a back room. We had breakfast in the hotel on one morning which was a bit chaotic but the choice of foods available on the buffet was excellent. We'd also recommend Taller de tapas just up the street. We also tried the restaurant, Senyor Parellada, on one evening which was a bit of a disappointment. The staff seemed rushed off their feet and we were left for ages without even having a drinks order taken. When we eventually did get our food, my boyfriend's starter was not what he had ordered and despite telling two different memebers of staff, we gave up and just ate what we had been given and left. We really enjoyed Lonja de tapas (near the picasso museum) and would definately recommend that as an alternative. Overall, this hotel is a great find that offers good value for money in an absolutely fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Hall
Reviews.Content: There are many good reviews of this small hotel and it is certainly in the most perfect location for a Barcelona visit. Unfortunately, the wall to our room was paper thin and I had to bang on it in the night to stop our neighbour snoring. There is a good buffet breakfast but it tends to be a bit fraught with all the guests filling up. An alternative is the Taller de Tapas at no 51 which has a good breakfast menu (from 9am) and is a bit more relaxed. Newspapers from the vendor at the Metro entrance at the top of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: PandaPaws
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the hotel and 1 night in the suites because of booking issues (that we were told about in advance). Most of my comments are re the hotel. First, the bad. This hotel looks chic, but it was all done on the cheap and now it's showing its age. Nothing major, just a lot of little things that, taken together, made it seem shabby. The floors were fake wood and were buckling, giving a weird squishy uneven feeling when you walked around, the magnifying mirror (which you sort of had to use because it was lighted and the bathroom was so dark) had broken and was floppy so you had to hold it up to look in it, the sink plugs had broken off their chains and were just left that way, stuff like that. Also there was dust on the tables and lamps, the floor felt gritty, and the idea to paint the shower black wasn't a good one because the housekeepers are apparently unable to remove the white water grime. The room we had 3 nights faced a side street and didn't have much street noise when the windows were closed, but it was right by the elevator, which was quite loud. Also had a very ill-mannered American woman across the hall the first night who evidently had a spat with her boyfriend and was slamming doors and yelling for an extended period starting around 2:30 in the morning. Not exactly the hotel's fault, but I felt like it was sort of the kind of place that attracts the wrong clientele or something. The room was dark. There was no wifi available, even in the lobby, but there were two computers for guest use. I think there were DSL connections in the rooms, but we hadn't brought a laptop, just iphones. The good. Complimentary bottled water was a perk. The air conditioning worked well. Location was excellent, just a half block from the metro and right in the heart of great shopping and restaurants. I liked the neighborhood best of any we visited in Barcelona - a nice feel with little narrow streets, not much traffic, a very young crowd. Graffiti focused on political themes, which to my mind is best if there has to be graffiti. There was a little restaurant close by called Bubo that we ate at several times and liked a lot. Best coffee we found anywhere in Spain, for one thing, and the desserts were fantastic. The suite: not technically a suite, but much larger, quieter, and it was nice not to have to exchange fake smiles with the hotel desk staff, who were not exactly friendly. The suites are a few blocks away from the hotel, and we never saw another soul in the building while we were there. I might have felt a little uncomfortable if I had been alone, especially with the sign telling you not to sleep or leave the room with the window open. But as it was, it was sort of nice. The suite had the same decor, but didn't have the same shabby feel our room in the hotel did.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: NPUk
Reviews.Content: Despite the pathetic value of the British pound against the Euro, this hotel still offers excellent value for money in a fantastic location. Rooms are spotlessly clean and whilst not huge are extremely comfortable, with a small balcony overlooking the street below. Free still and sparkling water and fruit is provided on each floor which is a really nice gesture, where other hotels would put it in your room and then charge an extortionate price for it. Didn't bother trying the breakfast which is a reasonable 10 euros since the hotel is surrounded by plenty of places to grap a drink, quick snack or a meal. Great sandwiches which are big enough for two are avaiable at the nearby "La Colmena" pastisseria, for 3 euros. The location is one of the best things about this hotel, being close to all the major sights and transport links without ever feeling too touristy. There are loads of really cool drinking bars, restaurants, shops, cafes, ice cream shops and tapas bars all around this area, many hidden in quiet narrow side streets which you can spend hours exploring. Pintxos must be the best invention ever..! The area is fairly busy but I didn't notice the noise, although in fairness we were out quite late ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable, & well-located”
Reviews.Author: katytudi
Reviews.Content: What an elegant little beauty, well-located to experience Barcelona! The staff is courteous and helpful; the rooms, beautiful. Our only concern was the air conditioning, which we couldn't seem to manage well, but if we had raised the concern - we didn't-- I feel certain the staff would have helped. And there's free, fast Internet service in the room. It was a pleasure to come back to the hotel each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, good Value for Money, Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janergy-worldwide
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Banys for two nights, just to spend the Weekend in Barcelona and found it very nice and comfortable. I lived for one year in Barcelona and know the city centre very well. Bany Orientals is located perfectly in the heart of the Gótico Area and you really find everything near to you (even Metro and Bus). The value you get for the money you pay is above average for Barcelona. Even for bad Hostals I paid only 20 EUR less, compared to Banys Orientals, if you like the Hostal rooms with own bathroom. The Hotel has a very nice abstract and cosy style, the breakfast is very good and the service as well. If you get a room to the street it is of corse not very silent, but this is the charme of the mediteranean City of Barcelona. Some small things of course are nice to see, but not very good to use. The lightning of the bathroom indeed should be improved (especially at the sink and mirror), but this wasn´t really a problem. I felt very good "at home" in the Banys Orientals rooms. Especially our room had two levels. Entering you could go directly in the bathroom/WC. Going some steps down (wooden steps in the material of the floor, very nice!) there was a hugh bed that was of a good quality. A small balcony to look, what is going on on the street, a big window with good curtains (no light enters at morning!) a small table with nice lamps on it, pictures on the wall - all those things made it overall a nice space to stay. Not very big, but to relax after walks through Barcelona. I will go to BO again. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Uma78Norway
Reviews.Content: A great hotel!! Very central location, close to the beach, the shopping area, etc. Breakfast was super - tortillas, manchego, ham... Beautiful, oriental-like design. Free Internet access! We asked for one of the suites, located two minutes away from the hotel itself, to avoid noice. Happy about that. If you want to stay at this hotel in July and August, you should book early. We made a reservation in February/March.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tara5954
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Banys Orientals hotel 23rd to 26 July '09. We arrived at the hotel very late on the 23rd, there were 6 of us, so 2 taxis from the airport to the hotel cost 32 euros each. Check in was really easy and we were greeted by our names which was a nice touch (and very easy I am guessing by process of elimination of guest arrivals). We were given rooms 101, 102 and 403. 101/102 were two twin rooms and 403 was a double bed. On each floor was a fridge containing still & sparkling water, and also fruit on the 4th. A couple of nights, we requested an iron/ironing board - which were brought to the room in less than 5 mins each time.
