There is also a hairdryer in the bathroom and two amentity kits should you need them... toothbrush, comb.. sponge etc. Everyone (all the staff) was really friendly and polite..... and actually really helpful. The size of the rooms were ok, i wouldnt say large but i have stayed in a lot smaller, say in Paris. So very happy and i would most definitely stay there again and highly recommend. The Bus Turistic stops literally 2 mins from the hotel - near the beach - near everything really.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: clouds07
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time in this hotel and I still like it as one of the best situated hotels in Barcelona - if you want to enjoy evenings out not using a cab but just finding the nicest places in walking distance from your hotel. The rooms aren't very spacious, but you find everything you need (all the standards like TV, safe, ...) with one exception: there is no mini bar in the room. Instead you have a big fridge on every store where you find mineral water (still & sparkling) for free(!!!), as well as a basket with fruits. The service is very nice and helpful. In the basement of the hotel is a very famous restaurant, but there are so many others around, and tapas and wine bars, ... that I still haven't been there. Don't forget to have a look at Santa Maria del Mar, the church is not even a 5 min walk away and on a Saturday you may be sure to see a real Spanish wedding. What I like best is the situation of the hotel and the quietness inside although being in the middle this throbbing atmosphere of Barcelona. What I like least: the bathrooms begin to age a bit

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: babygotoo
Reviews.Content: Good mid range hotel in very good location. Tube is 2 min walk away, lots of bars and reataurants on your doorstep, other main attractions such as Placa Rei, Ramblas, Gotic all less than 12 min walk away. Free internet, water and air con. Found the staff helpful when organising transport back to the airport. It is very noisy so ask for an interior room if you think that will be a problem and if you like a tea or coffee first thing in the morning take a travel kettle as one is not provided. (Great takeaway coffee shop towards the church at the bottom of the road, not open until 10.) Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Location, Comfortable Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Popoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Banys Orientals, in Barcelona's Bourne district is a great deal. For 99 euros our room was reasonably large, very modern and immaculately clean. Two high speed internet terminals were available 24 hours a day. The location was great, with lots of people coming and going, numerous tapas bars and retaurants on the narrow street right outside the hotel's front door. The hotel restaurant, open to thre public was quite popular for dinner although we did not eat there, enjoying the tapas bars instead. If you would like to start the day with a solid meal the hotel's optional extra cost buffet breakfast (10 euros) is worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: LittlebobB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Banys for five days in May and I can't reccomend this hotel enough. The location is fantastic and I think for the price the hotel was outstanding. We requested a quiet room so I can't comment on the noise but it is down a busy pedestrianised street so I can imagine a room at the front of the hotel would be noisy. The room we had was small but perfectly adequate for our needs, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom well equipped. The staff were generally not that friendly but they were helpful when we asked for anything. We didn't find the restaurant at the hotel to be that great. Cal Pep near by is great for lunch or informal dinner and if you want somewhere special but expensive the restaurant Noti is amazing. Another special place for dinner is Somorrostro in Barceloneta, a real find down a small street you wouldn't usually come across, the food is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: ksaltus
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at Hotel Banys Orientals after reading its excellent reviews in Frommer's and Lonely Planet travel guides. This fantastic hotel is located just off of a main street in one of the best parts of Barcelona. It is surrounded by great restaurants and a quick walk to many tourist attractions and the stops on the hop-on-hop-off bus tours. The rooms were on the smaller side, but very comfortable and very clean. We asked for a front facing room and enjoyed the birds-eye view of the street and the breeze at night. The staff were friendly and helpful; check in and check out were a breeze. I researched tons of hotels in Barcelona before booking this one, and for the cost (we paid $97.50E per night), there was not a better hotel than this one! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: chat_en_route
Reviews.Content: My husband and I intended to stay in this hotel for 5 nights. We booked the suite to be able to spend some nice comfortable time during our stay. The hotel for us was a complete disappointment: - The suite is far from the main hotel. - Very loud, even with all windows closed, we could still hear every little noise from the street. (not even mentioning the loud motorbikes and constructions) - The lighting is poor. (very dark and not practicable) - TV is small, very far away from the bed and only provides local stations. Besides the facts above, the bathroom was the main problem for me. The water got cold after 10 min shower. The shower cabin is half open, so a lot of water ended up outside, from this not only the wooden frame of the cabin has suffered and went bad, but also it appears that from earlier showers the wooden floor of the suite itself has suffered. We reported this problem to the front desk at the first afternoon we arrived. They confirmed to check. The other morning we informed them again, they said it was already fixed. BUT again, the same thing happened, I stood in shower with cold water. We asked for solution or another room, which was not possible as the hotel was fully booked. At the moment we were already exhausted of discussion, we said we'd like to check out. During packing for leaving, they called us again and said they would like to send a professional technician to fix it and also would offer us some discount while staying here. Nevertheless, they did not confirm a specific discount and the attitude of one staff on the phone was incredibly unfriendly and impatient so we finally decided to leave. While doing check-out at the front desk, the unfriendly staff did not apology but insisted on being right and told us hotel rooms with problems were normal. Also he kept complaining about us in Spanish. My husband was very unpleased and we had to waste one full day with discussion, checking out, finding a new hotel and being angry with a bad choice we made. Anyway the bedroom of the suite was big, with a comfortable bed. The hotel offers Free internet ( but slow and no wi-fi), free water and three free apples. Some of the staffs were very supportive and helpful with the problems, but a bad unprofessional staff made this hotel the worst place we've stayed so far.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: H-Wilmes
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant trip to Barcelona, city of Gaudi. The three of us agree with the positive reviews about this hotel. We were very happy here: the rooms are very nice indeed, location cannot be better, hotel amenities excellent, including the free water and apples at each floor, excellent european breakfast buffet, cleanliness, reception staff very helpfull and friendly. The location in the Barri Gotic is excellent: the major sights are all within easy walking distance: Barceloneta, Modernista buildings on the Passeig de Gracia, the Rambla, Palau de la Musica. For the Sagrada Familia church you need to get a subway train or bus. The subway station is right next door. Very handy. The Born district of Barcelona has many tapas bars and restaurants and many (upmarket) boutiques. Overall a nice and safe place to stay. However, if you are planning to wake up later than 7.30 in the morning this is probably not the place for you. Every morning around this time construction work starts in neighboring buildings. Likewise: if you sleep light, be advised: from 11 till 2 at night empty wine bottles are thrown by the bucket load into dumpsters. It is fair to say this goes with the territory, as this is a district with bars and restaurants open till late at night. It did not bother us that much: we stayed from sunday night till thursday, only sunday night was very noisy. We always get up early, so we were not bothered with all the construction work going on. As to the tapas bars in the same street as the hotel: we liked the Tapas bar La taberna del Cobre a lot: good food, nice, efficient service and a very reasonable price. We were very unhappy with the Taller de Tapas bar (also on the same street as the hotel) : when we were getting ready to order our food and drinks, we wanted to order three glasses of wine. The waiter tried to talk us into buying a bottle which was not what we wanted, and a lot more expensive than the price in neighboring bars and tapas restaurants. He was very obnoxious and insisted that a bottle would be our best buy. His cheapest offer was 4,80 euro per glass. As we prepared to leave, he suddenly discovered the housewine that was 2,80 per glass. By now however, we were angry and so put off by this obvious attempt at ripping us off, that we got up and left - and went next door, to the Cobre tapas bar for the second time, where we were given a free drink after our dinner! We don't know what the quality of the food at the Taller is, but we DO KNOW that we don't like to be treated like this. This restaurant was always very busy, so probably the food is okay, but its probably wise to be alert and don't be railroaded into ordering things you really don't need or want. We had great food and wine in all tapas bars in the area. Barcelona is a great city to visit and the Banys is without doubt excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a loft in a palace”
Reviews.Author: ClassicalCellist
Reviews.Content: this was one of the loveliest hotels i have stayed in and as a musician i have stayed in may lovely hotels! the suite - which was the only thing left to book - was a loft in an old palace, three doors down on the main street ( i do not understand previous reviewers here...) with a central staircase. it was my painter husbands fiftieth birthday and i was a little nervous, but the ceiling height, the huge bed, floor to cieling windows, the private entrance and the tasteful modern city vibe combined with the beams and windows of an ancient building were just perfect. my husband even managed to do a painting! i could have little niggles - wish there had been a bath, tiny showerhead in massive tiled shower cubicle...staff perhaps a little overworked, but we are none of us perfect! here you are in a great private place in the best area of barcelona for such a reasonable price! i will probably book a room in the hotel next just to save on expenses, but this was a worthwhile treat i highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LRAPPE
Reviews.Content: Staying in Barcelona was not for sight seeing or vacation on this occasion. I chose a suite as I wanted additional space for luggage etc and to be able to sit and relax whilst sorting out my forthcoming travel plans etc. The suites turned out to be located in an apartment building down a narrow alley distanced some way from the main hotel. There were some homeless people and stray dogs around and I did not feel very safe walking at night back to the room. The suite itself was over-looked by opposite apartments which meant one had to keep the curtains drawn all of the time. The sitting area (an uncomforatble settee/bed) of the bedroom was divorced from viewing the TV and had very poor lighting. If you understand Spainish then you will OK to watch TV. The hotel receptionist said that the TV's in the suites could not have the language changed on the TV set. In fact the reception on the TV was pretty poor anyway - I guess it was due to the alley way location. To view the TV required one to sit on the bed as there were no armchairs - only one upright chair at the desk location. Free internet access in the room was an appealing asset of the hotel advertised facilities Yet at the desk area there was no telephone point so it was necessary to sit on the bed where the telephone point was located under the bedside table. So it was not comfortable to work at ones' laptop siting on the bed. Three of the lights were not working in the room and had to be replaced. So in other words housekeeping had not really checked out the room. Whilst there was free water in the refrigerator, two of the botles had been opened and partially used! Another housekeeping failure. As the room was away from the hotel it would have been nice if coffee making facilites had been included in this room price. We used the dining rooom in the evening and whilst it seemingly has a good reputation, the meal was not exceptional as we had hoped. The femail receptionists on the arrival afternoon were very friendly and helpful as they could be which could not be said of their male counterparts the following morning. No smiles greeted you and they behaved as they were doing you a favour. I politley reminded the hotel of some of the inadequacies of the room and things that still needed to be addressed before there were new room occupants. I also suggested that it would be helpful to have an actual clock in the room. The receptionist pointed to my wristwatch and asked why I could not use that instead. I guess he thought it would be fine to sit up in the night and turn on the dim (low voltage) provided light bulb to see what the time was; remember there was inadequate lighting in the room and due to being over-looked no natural daylight either. So an illuminated clock would be of distinct help to any future user. So I guess if I am being asked what did I think of the hotel ,,, then I would say "Disappointed". I certainly would not recommend using a suite until you have checked that all of the above have been considered and dealt with by the owners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites”
Reviews.Author: BuccaneerDave
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the suites at the Banys Oriental. The suite we had was spacious, quiet and clean. The bathroom was excellent as were the beds. The room amenities (free water, great bathroom kits) were excellent. Admittedly we knew that the suites were not connected to the hotel otherwise that would have been a bit of a problem for us as it appears to have been for other reviewers. You do feel a bit disconnected to the hotel however the advantage is you get to enjoy a hotel style apartment in a quieter area of El Born. We would most definitely return however might try the rooms in the main hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BootsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a family wedding taking place nearby and it was ideal because of the location. Located centrally in the centre everything is on hand. The area El Born district is really nice with lots of lovely tapas bars within a stones throw away. Very close to the marina and beach too. Nearby is a cafe / bistro called Milkat 21 Gignas (www.milkbarcelona.com) which is great for brunch If you come out of the hotel and turn left I'd recommend the tapas bars there (eaten in them several times) and a bit further up take a right and there is a bar called La Luna which is a good place to visit. I would make one note of warning, this is a touristy area and late at night the atmosphere changes (after the tapas bars shut)-don't go walking around on your own as there are a lot of unfriendly characters about. Also beware of carrying too many valuables with you. We enjoyed sitting out in the tapas bars on the friday night around midnight but the next evening we were still out post wedding at 1 / 2 am ish and it was quite a different story The hotel The staff were all really friendly and helpful during our stay and couldn't have done more for us. The rooms were nice but very modern. This was fine for us but if you don't like chic modern this isn't the place for you. The suits are of a generous size and located in a building a couple of doors down (something to be aware of if you have children). Our room was very spacious but some of the other family members rooms were not as big. The beds are the same size in all the rooms (very large about 6ft) which is great but the size of the bathroom varies and not all have baths. However this wasn't a problem for us as we didn't want to spend much time in the room. If your room doesn't have a fridge then there are some located in the hallways with free still and sparkling water which is really handy and a nice touch. I've been to Barcelona several times and would highly recommend it as a city to visit. Its easy to get around, there is lots to do and see and its a vibrant place. Agua on the beach front, near the Port Olympia, by Hotel Arts is a lovely restaurant (booking recommended). In a nutshell Excellent value, I'd stay again. Nicely designed hotel in the Born district, in the old town. Get’s booked up quickly

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hotels in Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: stretgang
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love the Hotel Banys Oriental because it got such great reviews here on Tripadvisor BUT my stay was almost a complete disaster. The desk staff is not knowledgeable about the city, beyond sending you to the sightseeing bus and directing you towards La Rambla. Everything else is as though they lived elsewhere. It's very true that the hotel is centrally located and that is by far the best thing one can say about it. The room we had was small with only a small kitchen type chair to sit on if you used the other one chair to open your luggage on. This is totally forgivable in my mind but my wife has a back issue and found the room very uncomfortable. The worst and most grevious offense was that we had a 6:30 AM flight and wanted a taxi for 5:00 Am so we requested a wake-up call for 4:15 AM The desk called at 5:00 when the cab driver got there and reminded them he was to carry us to the airport. It was a miracle we made it or our connections, hotel and plans for the rest of our trip would have been spoiled, not to mention we would have had to stay in Banys another night when they were admittedly completely booked. T

Reviews.Title: “Really recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SofiaofStockholm
Reviews.Content: Great location, really nice, clean rooms for under 100 euro per night for a double room.. what more can you ask for? I recommend this hotel to everyone I know, it's such a good place to stay for a weekend in barcelona. I will be staying there later this year again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Haven in El Born”
Reviews.Author: kezzah8
Reviews.Content: Having had a really bad experience staying in a prison-like hostel for our first couple of days in Barcelona, myself and my friend were looking for somewhere we would feel welcome and where we could relax after a hard day's touristing/partying! The Hotel Banys Oriental fulfilled all our needs, ticking all the boxes and more!! We were allocated one of the suites in the annexed building. We had reservations about being based away from the main hotel at first but these were unfounded. We were delighted with our chic, well-designed spacious suite with a balcony overlooking the pedestrianised street below us, and a mezzanine with comfy sofa. The decor was modern yet understated and elements of the original Gothic architecture had been retained which made this a unique hotel experience. I think what made our stay in the Hotel Banys so good was the fact that we were made to feel like we were being looked-after which was in stark contrast to our stay at the Hostal Fontanella just a short distance away (see my review under the title Control Freaks!). ALL the staff were SUPER helpful and friendly and were more than willing to make our stay the best it could possibly be. We thought the cost of the suite at 135euros was great value for the standard of decor and service we received. The added extras of free water in the fridge, a bowl of fruit and free internet access were just some of the details that made our stay in the Hotel Banys a memorable one. I've been telling all my friends about this gem of a boutique hotel!! GO THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “great bargain, but you literally get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: final_destination
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the recommendation of friends. For the price, you definitely cannot beat it, especially given that you are right in the middle of El Born, but it really is not all that (contrary to the glossy recommendation in the Phaidon Wallpaper Guide). The staff wasn't all that friendly - it was almost as if they were doing us a favor by answering our questions or helping us out - and the accomdations are just really basic. I just have a problem with two twin beds being put together and having it be called a double. Also, the black-tiled bathrooms had some sort of paper on them for "effect" and that was peeling on the shower floor - not exactly the most hygenic, to be honest. Worst of all, there was this blaring construction going on right outside of our window, which made siesta and sleeping in a bit of a challenge. If you just want a place to sleep, dump your stuff and shower this place is suitable, but if you want to pace yourself I would find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Price!”
Reviews.Author: Sthlm_man
Reviews.Content: We were three friends that stayed in one of the suites. Starting off... the location was very nice. Five minutes from the harbour with great restaurants and sights, ten minutes from Ramblas and a couple of blocks from the Jaume I metro station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We tried the breakfast one morning and it was a good buffé with lots to chose from, though I was missing a real good cafe con leche. We didn't try the restaurant for dinner, so I can't comment on that. As I said, we stayed in one of the suites. Ours was located in another building about 150 meters away. It was very spacious and stylishly decorated. Fruit and water were provided free of charge... love that! If things like room service and on hand staff are important to you, then the suites might not be what you want. But we are quite independent travellers and liked being on our own exploring the city using the room only for sleeping. And the price can't be beaten... 130 euros(+ 40 for extra bed) per night! I have been to Barcelona several times and had seen all of the major sights... so this time I did a day trip to the Montserrat monastery. It was wonderful... I highly recommend the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cool style in the old town”
Reviews.Author: The_Paying_Punter
Reviews.Content: The Banys Oriental is in the (old town) Ribera district of Barcelona and is very handy for the Picasso Museum and the other museums that occupy that street. It is also easy walking distance from the Ramblas. The hotel is not huge and is a refurbished old building decorated in a cool, calm and modern style with a confident touch. The room we had was a double and was adequately-sized but maybe just a touch on the cramped side to get round due to the large size of the beds. There is one small elevator serving all guest on all floors, so sometimes it can take a while to reach you. Nice touches were the big glass refrigerators on every floor, stocked with (free) chilled bottles of water, alongside big bowls of fruit. The attached restaurant is very good indeed and is popular and has a good reputation with non-guests as well. The big attraction of this hotel for me was the location on a traffic-free street in the heart of Ribera which meant that most places we wanted to go were within walking distance, Also, everything worked and it was calm, comfortable and stress-free. Would I go again? ... yes, very probably.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lienheuvel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 3 nights Our Stay was very pleasant The staff was very friendly including roomcleaningladies and technical staff.The ambiance was very relaxed en warm. The street was very cosie and authentic old .Nice shops and restaurants and a nice church end of the street, sundayevening mas open for everyone!!!Go there!!!10 minutes walk to beach and ramblas !!!!Nice beach barceloneta !About the hotel again,Very helpful receptionist ,and extreemly friendly. Nice rooms and spotless.And FREE COOL WATER at the corridor in fridge for guests . box with shampoo brush soap toothbrush toothpaste lotion slippers ect ect....Nice plasma tv with good channels . I woud go there again for sure !!!!!!Nothing negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediochre”
Reviews.Author: Bearfoot
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this after finding it in Style Europe. But to be honest was very average. The reception staff didn't exactly start off very well. When I arrived I had to leave my car badly parked and I asked the man at reception if someone could take my bag to my room while I parked my car. He told me I could take it myself! The room was OK , not very inspiring but adequate. The following morning I had to leave the hotel at 815 to catch my flight and was informed breakfast doesn't start till 8.30 which I thought was late for a saturday. Not even a cup of tea was available. I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: lienheuvel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at shis hotel for 3 nights Very nice helpfull staf and very friendly. Very clean room and big shower nice airco and plasma tv . safe in the room and bottles of drinkwater in de corridor for guests for free!!!!! I will come here again for sure . Location perfect 10 minutes walk to beach barcelonetta and 10 minutes walk to ramblas.Very nice church santa maria in street at sundayevening nice mas en impressing church if you like you can go there.I wiil recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a mix of old barcelona in a modern ambiance with lots of eating places bars shops and culture with the picasso museum on the corner !!!!!Very relaxed ambiance .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: MelFinch
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from the Banys Orientals, having booked following reviews we had read on this site. We booked direct by e-mail, and they were very efficient and answered questions promptly in English. We felt that the room price was excellent value. We caught the bus to Barcelona from Girona Airport with no trouble, and because it was very hot when we arrived at the bus station we decided against carrying luggage up and down stairs on the metro and caught a taxi instead - 15 minutes in heavy traffic, €8, not bad, and a friendly lady driver who dropped us off at the corner. We travelled around the city by metro on one day, using a ten journey ticket between the two of us, and found it easy, and the rest of the time we walked slowly because of the heat, and with a prolonged lunch somewhere, and a siesta back at the cool hotel that worked fine. Our second floor room was very stylish, especially the bathroom, but it was quite tight to get around the bed, and there was a huge wardrobe but no drawer space or hooks to keep things tidy. However, who cares, for three days? The wardrobe safe, air conditioning and free iced water and internet were all very much appreciated, and the bed was wonderful. We looked out at the back of the hotel on to a quiet area. The staff in reception were unfailingly helpful and courteous, those in the restaurant were less smiley, but did the necessary. We were using both English and Spanish and felt that their knowledge of both might have been less confident than the reception staff. We ate one dinner and all our breakfasts in the hotel, and they were all delicious and very good value, especially the breakfasts if you can eat lots from a buffet in the morning, easy to fill up and then you don't need much later. If you don't want to eat much for breakfast, it's probably cheaper to go elsewhere, like right next door to the hotel. We also had some lovely lunches and dinners in the bars and restaurants round the city, and can recommend the Taller de Tapas and the Taberna del Cobre in the same street as the hotel. We didn't know Barcelona, and three days was a good introduction, one for the historic central part, one for the port and beach area, and one for the Gaudí trail. Try the chocolate museum not far from the hotel! With ordinary city street awareness and common sense about what to carry when and where, we felt quite safe everywhere at all times. We shall go back for the rest of the sights at a slightly cooler time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MR9922
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend and booked through the hotel directly. The hotel is in an ideal location and within walking distance of the beach and La Rambla and Placa Catalanya where we caught the Bus Touristic. The welcome pack in the bathroom of the hotel is a nice touch, as are the complimentary bottles of water on each floor which you can help yourself to each day. It is a little noisy and the bathroom is like a sauna however these 2 negatives are totally outweighed by the location, clean and comfortable rooms which are well decorated and furnished, complimentary water, welcome pack, free internet access and directly above a superb restaurant (Senyor Parellada). The Santa Maria church and square are a stone's throw from the hotel. The square has a good wine bar called La Vinya del Senyor where you can sit outside in the square and watch the world go by with a glass or bottle of whatever your heart desires from a huge wine list. There are small restaurants and a bar (Buba) next door which are all worth a visit. If you walk round from the square in the direction of the zoo you'll find a boulevard which comes alive after 11pm with local bars - well worth a visit if you like to keep away from the tourist bars. Avoid the acclaimed restaurant called Los Caracoles - we had a terrible meal there which was very expensive. The paella was inedible and the bread rolls were stale. It was such a disappointment after having queued for a table. On a different night we also queued for La Fonda which is just a long the street from Los Caracoles. The meal was excellent and really good value for money - well worth queuing for. Sightseeing Tips: Casa Batllo is well worth a visit if you like to do something different indoors. Avoid the Vasquez part of the Picasso Museum as it is mind numbinging rubbish. Make a visit to Park Guell as a stop on the Bus Touristic route. Don't pay to enter the Sagrada Familia. The inside of the beautiful cathedral is literally a building site with nothing to see other than a queue of people waiting 90 minutes to get the lift to the top of one of the spires. The outside is breathtaking. The view from Park Guell is free and is just as lovely. The boating lake in the park next to the zoo is a good place to sit and soak up the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Noice.”
Reviews.Author: Toby-Jean
Reviews.Content: Just lovely. In a great part of town - the thing is in Barcelona, I don't think you want to be TOO central- Las Ramblas is hideous. However, this old town bit, quite near the beach and public transport is delightful. Nice, small, chic rooms. **Awesome** restaurant downstairs, lots of fun. Good staff, nothing bothered me about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Smuki79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2008. Contrary to some reviews I've read here our standard double room was not small. Granted the bed was enormous, but I found that rather charming. The hotel was very clean and modern and the service was great. I didn't quite like the black! shower, but I guess that's just a matter of taste. We had a room overlooking a quiet side street and we had no trouble with traffic or noise. Guests had free access to two computers on the second floor and there was complimentary water bottles for guests on every floor, very nice in the heat of July. The location of this hotel is superb. A short walk from La Ramblas, one metro stop from Barceloneta(the metro station right outside the hotel) and a number of charming botiques on every corner. But my number one selling argument would be the price. 99 euros a night. Trust me, that's a reasonable price for a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Clear898
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for three nights in June 2008. The hotel offered outstanding value for money and was in the ideal location close to great restaurants and bars. The decor is quite chic and the free internet and water was a nice bonus. Plus, it is a short walk from the waterfront and only a couple minutes from the subway. We ate at the Senyor Paradella in the hotel, which was excellent also and had a great deal of charm. I would definately recommend this hotel, without hesitating. Ensure you book well in advance though, as we booked four three months prior and still didn't get all the dates we had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but one rotten apple on the staff”
Reviews.Author: janehudson
Reviews.Content: Banys is a good choice for so many things--location, price, cleanliness, etc. The rooms are spare but stylish and comfortable. Another nice touch is that they supply free bottled water and fruit. There is no need to pay extra for the breakfast. There are cafes on either side of the hotel where you can get a good breakfast for a fraction of the price. We were a party of seven, with four rooms. After one night we decided to switch rooms--my aunt and uncle were going to move into our room and my husband and I were moving to a different room. This was okayed by the front desk. Someone told us the room number we'd be moving to and that we could move our luggage there. It was still being cleaned, but the maid let us bring the luggage in. My aunt and uncle brought their luggage to our old room. While my husband was down the street somewhere, I was waiting in the hall for the room to be ready, which was just supposed to take a couple more minutes. Then I heard angry footsteps approaching from the elevator. It was another guy from the front desk who was in a fury because we had already put our luggage in the room. He yelled at me in Spanish and broken English (including the word "stupido") and then stormed off to shout at my aunt, who was waiting in the lobby. He was angry because we had moved our luggage into the rooms before they were ready. My husband, who is fluent in Spanish, talked to him afterward and told him he had overreacted and that he shouldn't have yelled at us, that we had been told we could move the luggage. He gave my husband a grudging, ungracious apology. A couple of days later my uncle observed him yelling at another hotel guest in the lobby. We all wondered why this person chose a career in the customer service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chic”
Reviews.Author: MariaVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Great location in regards to being able to walk eveywhere. If you are driving, insist on the hotel sending you instructions/map on where to park- its all one way streets or inaccessible streets and you will spend a lot of time trying to figure out the jumble of old streets just to get to the hotel. Took way too long to find in a car . For the price, the rooms are nice, a bit on the small side. No room service or mini bar and no bathtub, but nice furniture and bath kits in the room. Staff a bit inconsistent- some nice, some not so. Free internet was nice. Clean and modern, hard to find a better deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Banys was almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: medina23
Reviews.Content: Banys Orientals was a chic, clean, and perfectly situated. A great value for a very good hotel. Hotel: Clean, simple and chic, nice little LCD tv in the room, great balcony views of the street action. The staff was friendly, the art in the room was nice, the bed was comfortable and the air conditioning unit in the room was fairly good but might be a concern if it would have been hot. Bathroom was nice enough, but didn't have very good water pressure in the shower to really make showering very enjoyable. We thought it was a good balance of modern and comfortable. Location: Right on Calle Argenteria which runs right through the La Ribera district (also known as the Born district). There was a lot of action right in front of and around the hotel. At the same time, it wasn't very noisy at all. The Born district is so full of life, and art/fashion is what this area is about. Plus some great restaurants, pastelerias, and shops within a few steps of the hotel. Additional Benefits: Free water bottles in the mini refrigerator on each floor. Two computers with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dbc1717
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel with one of the best locations in Barcelona. You can literally throw a ball from the hotel and hit the metro station and the Borne area is very nice and full of lively bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The service is very simple. Do not expect much. I would suggest bringing earplugs because the walls are thin and it's very noisy outside. The hotel is often full and hard to book but it's worth trying because the price is excellent. The restaurant next store called Senyor Parrellada is really good...fresh, good tasting, resonably priced food in a nice atmoshphere...can't ask for more in a restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: truprunbike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 24-26th, and i cant believe how inexpensive it is compared to everything else around. It is about a 5 minute walk to the Barcelona Cathedral, Picasso Musuem, or Las Ramblas. So its right in the middle of everything, The hotel lobby is on a fairly busy street/walkway with lots of shops and vendors everywhere. We stayed in a suite which is not conected to the lobby. It is about a 2 minute walk down the street next to Santa Maria Del Mar Cathedral. The suites are in an apartment bulding and the only bad thing is that there is no door man. I felt safe walking home at 3am, but i could see that some people might not. as it is down an alley a few steps The good thing about the suites, is that they are not on the main walkway, so they are pretty quit. The suites were huge with 2 rooms and a good size bathroom. The rooms came with a fridge and free water and fruit. They had no english TV stations however. The rooms had hardware floors and you are provided slippers, and the rooms are decorated very nice and simple. If this hotel made the lobby a little fancier, and maybe put a doorman at the suite building, it could easily charge 2x as much which is what all teh other hotels in the area charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located on a great little street in the center of Barcelona. If you enjoy convenience and value for money with a touch of design, this is the hotel for you! I won't repeat what the previous reviewer said about all the amenities (all true), but I will comment about the noise level. The hotel was EXTREMELY noisy, both from within the hotel and from the outside street. Sources of noise from within the hotel: the wooden floors, the lift (strangely loud) and the hotel's decision to start working on the plumbing at 8am. Sources of noise from outside the hotel: street cleaning trucks, revelers and drunks, and the single windows unfortunately did not guard us whatsoever. Honestly, i cannot understand anyone NOT being disturbed by the noise. Over breakfast we chatted with other guests who experienced the exact same thing even though their room was on the other side of the hotel. Oh, speaking of breakfast, SKIP IT. The selection looked old and unfresh. There are many options just outside the hotel and much more delicious. In conclusion, I would stay here again, but this time I'm going to bring ear plugs. Hopefully that will solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: “A chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: schnauzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel in El Born on 20April to 23 april. The hotel looks v chic and matches what is shown on the website. The room is not v big but we love what is provided. We have unlimited supply of water (still as well as sparkling) at a fridge by the lift, 2 computer terminals with free internet access, amenty kit with comb, hairbrush, sanitary napkin, a bathing sponge, shampoo, bath gel and body lotion. There is also a manifying mirror in the toilet. There are english channels like CNN and BBC which is good for the non-spanish speaking like us. The restaurant which belongs to the hotel serves fantastic food! Before arriving at the hotel, i was quite worried after reading so much comments about the noise. while it is true that the el born area is bustling at night, our room was really quiet as it does not face the street. So if u want some peace and quiet, request for one with the hotel. Only thing i don't like so much is that the toilet is a little dark at night with only the ambient lighting illuminating the toilet. We love the place and will definitely recommend it to out friends.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location!!”
Reviews.Author: cristina30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in a superb location! It is located in the Born Area, in a pedestrian street, 1 minute walking from the metro station. We loved the neighbourhood which was very lively and full of bars and restaurants! Now about the hotel itself... - We've stayed in a room (not suite) in the 4th floor and it was very small indeed! Also we have asked for a quiet room so they gave us one on the side street which was..'adequately' quiet!! (sometimes you could still hear some noise though but not a big deal...) - The bathroom was lovely but the power of the shower was not very good. - They have refrigerators with free bottles of water on every floor which was very nice. - They have two computers that you can use for free, or if you have your own laptop they give you a cable and you have free internet in the room! (big plus for us!) Overall our feeling of the hotel is really positive! I would definitely recommend it to friends because it's in the most amazing location (for me the best), nice decor and even though the rooms are small, but i think it is a great value for money hotel in Barcelona (100€/night),

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sigold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights the end of March. We stayed in one of the suites. The suite was very large and quiet. We enjoyed the space and the free water provided by the hotel in our refrigerator. The location could not have been better. We could walk everywhere. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. They could not do enough for us. The hotel even provided 2 computers for free internet service. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent and not pricey. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel since there were many options nearby. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: andiuk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Barcelona. The hotel was great, staff were friendly and kept in communication right up to the departure date. Rooms were fairly large, bright and clean. Bathroom was large and well equipped but did lack any kind of ventilation so took a while for steam to clear after a shower. All guests can have free bottled water and fruit which are placed on the landings. Hotel location quite central so not far to restaurants. Easy to get to from airport via bus and a 15 mins walk, you can get a metro to the end of the street if you don't like the walk. If arriving late would suggest taxi as tourists seem to get targeted by pickpockets. Recommendations for where to eat would be Les Quinze Nits in Placa Reial, you have to queue but food is good and fairly cheap. For the best ice cream I have ever had there is Gelaaati on C/Llibreteria next to Jaume I metro station.

Reviews.Title: “good location but if you are lucky you should sleep”
Reviews.Author: sayanes
Reviews.Content: The hotel has really good location. I could not sleep during the night due to terrible noises. fromthe street (it seemed that window was open) and the noise fromthe room close to you...i could listen all the things that the man close to my roomwas saying The decoration is nice... It was amazing that bed was without blanket..and we are in the winter.. Some staff are really nice and another are quite unrude...but I think that the management should follow up this matter, specially with the south american lady..from the breakfast...really bad bad manners...it seemed that she was annoying to give you the breakfast. Summarize. really good location, it is nice...but the problem is the noise and not professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but watch your wallet”
Reviews.Author: hard_travelin_too
Reviews.Content: This hotel has character and is in an excellent location. The restaurant is very good - reasonable prices, huge menu, very popular. Only blip in our stay was having one 50 euro note lifted from my wallet and one 20 Euro note lifted from my wife's purse while we were at breakfast and the room was being cleaned. Obviously we shouldn't have left the money in the room, but my issue was with the attitude of the hotel who rather than express any concern simply refused to accept that it could possibly have been their cleaner and must have been an opportunist thief come in from the street. Quite a strange thief - goes up to the third floor of a small hotel, sneaks into a small room without the cleaner in the room seeing him and then takes one note from each of two purses/wallets, leaving loads of other notes behind and returning the purse and wallet to the pockets of clothes in the room. The hotel (and cleaner) were no doubt banking (correctly) that we wouldn't bother wasting half a day of a two day trip to Barcelona at the police station!

Reviews.Title: “chic but noisy”
Reviews.Author: FritziN
Reviews.Content: The location is great. We were very excited to get a room here based on press and photos (and price). The place is very chic but the noise level in the room ruined everything. The shower was also smelly (mildew) which made the room smell, and the tile had been painted over! Our room was 3rd floor above the alley outside the restaurant kitchen so after the kitchen noise finally died down, the motorbikes started up. This is a common thing in Barcelona, becuase of the late nights and small alleys, unless you can find a hotel w/ dual glazed / modern windows. We switched to the Grand Hotel Centrale down the street and loved it. At that point I would have paid anything for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SineadO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights just before Christmas, loved the central location on a pedestrianised street in El Born with lots of tapas and bars nearby, also 1minute from Metro Jaume. Rooms are a little small but partly due to massive four-poster bed which was so comfy we slept 12 hours on first night. Good bathroom with walk-in shower and separate toilet. Also tucked in to buffet breakfast, standard fare but good value for 10 euro. Best hotel I've stayed at in Barcelona - 98 euro for a double,a bargain too

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyIreland
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. great location, within walking distance to most of the major sights and close to an underground line. we stayed in one of the suites, very large, modern, airy room. staff very helpful. would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bubbafranks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the absolute best location in Barcelona!! It made our trip because of where we were. We could walk to everything--there were great restaurants around, great tapas bars, a beautiful old cathedral, and nightclubs. We did have to change rooms after the first night though because of the noise. We could literally hear the couple next door have all of their conversations. You can also hear everyone walking around the hallways. But, if you can get a room where you just hear the people walking by and not your neighbor, you'll have a great experience. The bathrooms were modern and clean. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKfromMoseley
Reviews.Content: A group of nine stayed at the Banys Oriental for a four night stay. Our journey couldn't have begun more badly! A five hour flight delay meant that we eventually arrived at the hotel at 3am. This is where it began to go well. We were greeted by a very welcoming young man, who booked us all in with great charm and a warm welcome for such a late hour. The rooms are individually designed to fit the space available in an oldish building. This said they are very smart, with all the features that you could wish. Not large, but big enough for a stay of our length. The shower in our room was spectacular! Breakfast is an extra but well worth it. A huge array of cold meats, boiled eggs, spanish omelette, cereals and enough pastries to keep you going all day. The attached restaurant serves Catalan food to a high standard but you will need to book - we got in our our last night. If we go back to Barcelona, and I do hope we will, we will definitely stay at the Banys Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Fab Staff, Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: RossieDublin
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, great staff, good food, good location - complimentary water excellent touch....................will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute GEM”
Reviews.Author: Boo31
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me- and i can not recommend it more highly to you! It is an amazing city, and this is an absolute gem of a hotel- we actually stayed at the adjoining apartments. Only €125 per night!! Gorgeous, clean, complimentary fruit/water in your own fridge!! Small mezzanine floor with small sofa/ bed- just cool for a chill out! Two small balconys- only enough room to stand out on- with amazing, if a bit restricted, views. Bed is two twins alongside, encased in a four poster frame. Very comfy- didn't mind the twins at all. BAthrooms were kitted out better than some 5 stars I've stayed in! Complimentary everything. We lost our lauggage, and the hotel even supplied a toothbrush- and they didn't know- it is a complimentary service, And a great touch. Absolutely central, and absolutely chic. Gorgeous Tapas Bar downstairs- reasonable and friendly. Fav roaming places were Gothis quarter and the Plaza Real- just around the corner- towards Las Ramblas. There's a wee street at the top of L'Argentaria, if you turn right and walk 200 metres (if even) there's a lovely little supermarket for water or wine!! I had emailed the staff in advance, and always got a prompt and friendly reply, no matter what the request. Absolute pleasure to stay here- could only be bettered if they were to introduce pool/ sauna etc... Go- and you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Smack dab in the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Hopejoy
Reviews.Content: I found Bany's to be a contemporary hotel in a great area. Close to Las Ramblas, the Picasso museum and several very interesting Barcelona icons. It may not be the place for travelers who like a lot of peace and quite but if you're looking to enjoy the city and be in walking distance of most things, then it's the place for you! We booked several suites along with doubles. The locations of the suites are a good little ways from the main facility but were safe and comfortable. We'll return here again and encourage others to do the same. It's a great deal for the $$$$$. The staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “For the money...this is a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: j4innc
Reviews.Content: The Banys Oriental Hotel was, for central Barcelona, very reasonably priced. For this price range, I thought the hotel was wonderful. The location is great - within walking distance of the Cathedral, the Santa Maria del Mar, the harbor, the Ramblas, and great shopping. Metro and bus are also close by. I would note that the street noise can be a bit loud at night (particularly since locals keep later hours than the average Brit, American or German). This did not bother me at all, but I can see that if you were a light sleeper, you might find the level of activity at 1 a.m. to be bothersome. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant next door had good food and I would recommend making a reservation for dinner there. The breakfast was expensive (10 Euro per day), but the variety of items was excellent. We only had breakfast in the hotel twice and of course, it was a European breakfast ( a lot of different rolls, breads, croissants), cheeses, meats, cereals, soft boiled eggs, and fruit. There were a lot of options and the quality was good. If you just want coffee and a croissant or a panini, I would recommend skipping the hotel breakfast and heading out to a local cafe (considerably less expensive). The hotel also has computers that you can use on the second floor to check your e-mail or surf the Web. This is free of charge and I found it to be a nice service in terms of checking in with home. The rooms themselves are very nice ...contemporary design and very clean. The hotel provides slippers, shampoo, bath gel, lotion, a hairbrush, comb, sponge, toothbrush, showercap, etc. to guests. This was a nice perk. For this class of hotel, I really only expected soap and perhaps shampoo, so I was pleasantly surprised at all the other toiletries. The bathroom was also nice, if small. The only thing that I really didn't like about the room was that the bathroom had no ventilation...fan or otherwise. As a result, there was always a lingering mildew smell in the bathroom. Finally, the hotel provided a refrigerator full of bottled water, available to guests on the floor. I thought this was a very nice amenity, given that restaurants and shops will charge you 1 or 2 Euros for the same bottle of water. In short, if you want to be in the center of the action and you want good value for your money, this hotel comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This Should Have Been So Much Beter...”
Reviews.Author: DrEthan725
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Barcelona before, I have no basis of comparison to other properties in Barcelona. That said, the location was perfect. In the heart of EVERYTHING, and we could be just about anywhere we wanted within a short 5-10 minute walk. To have that kind of central location without all of the crazy noise, was a plus. The hotel was reasonably priced. The rooms were really not well designed. They had nice furniture, linens and such, but they were not well laid-out. For example, we were in a King-Bed room. The Four-Poster Bed took up over 95% of the room. We literally spent our time negotiaing the 1 meter perimeter of the room AROUND the bed. The closet was unacceptably small and there was no chest of drawers so we were living out of our suitcases. Also, there was no room for the suitcases, so we piled them up around the bed, making it even harder to move around. The bathroom was nice and clean, but there was no ventilation and it had a musty smell. Frankly, for a "boutique" hotel in Europe, I was hoping for something a bit more elegant and with the basics- room to put our suitcases, hang up clothes, and a room which could be navigated without having to step over and around (or side-step) the furniture. Very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasticly priced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: noidentity
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this hotel by a friend who lives in Barcelona, and what a find... GREAT location, right in the heart of the gothic quarter, very close to Barcelonetta and the port, and so easy to walk to the main shopping street and ramblas... nice decor in the hotel, rooms a little small (although we did have a cot in the room so next time i would book a suite) and although i was a little disappointed there was no bath for my toddler, she really enjoyed the 'wet room' shower. the free water and apples in the coIridoors were a really nice touch - staff were very friendly and welcomed our toddler with open arms. All in all, a great experience, great value for money and fab location - would recommend it to anyone after a boutique style hotel, travelling with children, wanting to be in the best area of town - for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “simplistic loveliness, perfect honeymoon retreat”
Reviews.Author: jaylo04
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel in the heart of the the gothic area in Barcelona was a wonderfull choice for our honeymoon. Having never been to Barcelona before, we found it to be perfectly located for many of the main 'attractions' which meant other than a taxi to Parc Guell we walked everywhere. We stayed in a lovely suite, which when booking we were given the impression were around the corner, are actually about 3 mins walk away on a quiet non commercial street, in a building shared with other apartments/suites. Having said that it meant it was extrodinarily quiet for mid city and we felt a little more independent. It was cleaned daily though, including fresh towels & linen, and was very spacious, fab slate tiled bathroom! The buffet breakfast was great, but a bit pricey at 10 euors a head when there is a fab little pastry shop 3 doors up from the main hotel where you can both eat for 7! There are also some wonderful tapas bars on your doorstep, not to mention ice cream shops!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Chainring
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, friendly staff. Barcelona is full of hotels; most are hideously overpriced. The Banys Orientals is a welcome exception to the rule. While not inexpensive, at least you get a sparkling clean room in a wonderful, quiet location. I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town! This place is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: bostontravelbugs
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I ever bothered to write a review for anything. The hotel is conveniently located across the main street from the Barri Gotic area in a lively side street and close to many other attractions in town. Some reviews complained about the noise level, so we requested for a quieter room in the back and didn't have a problem at all. The Euro went far for this hotel in that the decor in the room is nice, modern, clean and reasonably sized. The hotel also provided free bottled water and fruits. There's also a really tasty tapas bar just down the street called Sagardi. The staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: cjsummers78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Banys on our honeymoon. It was our first visit to Barcelona, and we found the location to be exactly what we wanted! The staff was helpful in recommending dining options and the free bottled water was a nice perk. Rooms were good size and very clean. We would absolutely stay here on another visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Colonies
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of their suites for four nights. A great location in Barcelona, very reasonable price, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but loud”
Reviews.Author: XelaHH
Reviews.Content: The Banys Orientals has many advantages: good location, highly affordable and well-decorated. The huge disadvantage: it's clairaudient. We stayed on the top floor and heard everything from the room besides us: The conversations of an elderly couple (word by word), the zipper of their baggage etc. And, probably most annoying of it all: The sound of the elevator. All night long. We have never stayed in a hotel that clairaudient. If you want to have some peace on your holidays, go somewhere else. If deaf: nice choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: wayne&Lydia
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, My partner and I and another couple we went with looked at a number of hotels within this price range. All were very basic and below basic from what we could see from photos on websites and so on. All really quite bland until we were reccommended the Hotel Banys Oriental. Really glad we were as its a really really nice hotel particularly when compared to the other hotels we had seen, for the same price!! They had sold out of the normal rooms so we went for Suites.They were really good in size and you could tell that the whole hotel had pretty much been newly renovated. Really nice modern quality mixed with a bit of character. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Free water in the fridge. Brilliantly located Hotel. Close to everything. Lots of little boutique shops for trendy mens and womens clothing. Some lovely restaurents and bars also nearby. The metro just at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: IOWtravelbabes
Reviews.Content: What a location - less than a minute's walk from the Jaume I metro, right in the heart of the Born and surrounded by bars and restaurants - perfect! We were expecting a slightly small room, from previous reviews and this is the case, but to be fair, at 98 Euros per night, you can live with it! The bathroom, whilst stylish was in need of some renovation, with quite significant water damage around the bath - again, you get what you pay for. We loved Barcelona and in particular this area and would definitely return - so many great bars and restaurants, right on your doorstep and all very reasonable. We stayed for 4 nights and would gladly have stayed for longer - you need the time to visit all the amazing sites and architecture. We flew to Girona, where we stayed for 2 nights, then got the train to Barcelona. On our return we got the Bus from Barcelona back to Girona Airport - all incredibly easy and convenient and cheap. A nice touch at the hotel is free mineral water on each of the floors, together with free internet access - quite a plus when considering how reasonable the room rates are. On the downside, there is some street noise outside, mainly commercial bin/bottle collections, although this was only bad on one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DMcC27b
Reviews.Content: I had checked various websites including "tripadvisor" before booking this hotel for a long weekend with my wife and another couple. However closer to our departure I got a bit nervous as some of the reviews were not favourable but I decided to stick with our original (and very cheap) booking. I need not have worried. The location (in El Born) is fantastic with so many shops, restaurants and cafes nearby in little sidestreets and squares. The hotel reception is little more than a desk and anyone who wants a grand lobby, bar or even a great buzz from the hotel will be disappointed. However all of these things are provided by the area in spades so the lack of facilities were made up by the rooms. We had booked suites which were a few hundred yards away off the Placa Santa Maria which again had plenty of life both day and night. The rooms were very spacious and well-kept. The decor was modern and minimal without being sparse. They are like small apartments with a shared communal entrance but at @ £90 per night they were a bargain. I would have no hesutation staying there again and although some reviews said staff could be surly they booked a restaurant and taxis for us with no difficulty and were very courteous. If you spend a lot of time around your hotel go somewhere else but if you enjoy a little bit of luxury at a knockdown price book it now.

Reviews.Title: “rip-off banys”
Reviews.Author: hopeless
Reviews.Content: surly staff, smelly room, noisy, and conned us with the exchange rate and wouldn't respond to my requests for an explanation. Don't go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the money, but a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: danielswiss64
Reviews.Content: It's a nice and modern hotel. We stayed for four nights. We stayed in the suites which is in a separate building about 5 minutes away from the main location. It gives you a feeling of having your own apartment in Barcelona. Our suite was huge and very classy, cool, and modern. It's surrounded by tine old streets and so you can hear whatever goes on. We stayed on the first floor. This is the metalsmithing area so you can hear some of that. Also, when people talk in the streets, you may be able to hear it. The room was beautiful and airy. TV only had Spanish local channels. Bathroom had a huge shower, but some of the fixtures were coming out of the wall (soap dish).

Reviews.Title: “cool style”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_cloud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banys for 3 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were not terribly huge, but big enough, and furnished very nicely. Cool, stylish design, a nice view from our 2nd story window to the pedestrian alley below with the Christmas market. Located very close to the old quarter of Barcelona, the hotel is walking distance from so many attractions - we walked down to the harbor, into the old city, all over the place! Breakfast at the hotel did cost extra, but was worth it overall - lots of choices. The free water in the fridge in the hallway was absolutely delicious and a refreshing surprise! Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JamieW
Reviews.Content: Great location in busy area with lots of bars, great restaurants and shops. We booked a suite and therefore were located in the annexe ....a few hundred yards down the street from the main hotel and up a dark quiet street. Perhaps not the best location if you're a lone female traveller. Main hotel would have been nicer for the buzz. Hotel restaurant was lovely though and great value. Suite was large but a bit worn around the ages and would be easy enough to fix. The lift would only take one passenger at a time, bathroom full of scuff marks which a quick lick of paint would easily sort. No English TV apparently if that's a concern to you.

Reviews.Title: “Internal Noise A Problem”
Reviews.Author: dimple_pie
Reviews.Content: + Points Location in El Born Complimentary Bottled Water + fruit on each floor Reasonable size room and liked the "walk in" shower Restaurant next door offers decent food at a decent prize. Warning very busy ! - Points Internal nosie from stairs, lift, next door - the walls must be thin could hear next door showering. Also street noise, although we were at the side not overlooking the main street, windows are not soundproofed. Staff were ok by and large - not as bad as feared. For the price offers ok value in comparison with similar boutique hotels we have stayed in in Barcelona (Balmes, Granados, Actual). Would stay again but probably not for light sleepers !

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: wonni
Reviews.Content: I would definetely recommend the hotel. It is in a central very good location near a lot of bars and restaurantes in the middle of the old city. The hotel is stylish and clean. Rooms are small but nice. Staff was helpful, complications with our booking confirmation were solved by them immediately. So just go for it ..you get good value for what you pay!!! Negative are only the thin walls, sometimes it was a bit noisy....but therefore you are in the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Do not reccomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 5 rooms for a week end early this month. I do not recommend it to others. Good: Location The appealing design and decor One nice receptionist and nice housekeeping staff Nice touch having free water and fruit on the floors. Bad: You can hear everything from the room next door (I mean everything, even coughing) No lobby area where you can wait for your friends. The housekeepers do help themselves from the buffets in the restaurant. I think they could have the same items but from the kitchen. Staff in breakfast talk between them as if they were in the back offices of the hotel. (very impolite) Front desk staff not warm at all. Will never come back.

Reviews.Title: “I do not reccommend this place!!”
Reviews.Author: haims
Reviews.Content: I spent about 5 nights at Banys Orientals with my boyfriend this past November, 2006, and would not recommend it to others. Despite the great location of this hotel, and the appealing design and decor, we found the staff to be inhospitalble, unhelpful, and at times, rude. We also ate at their restuarant next door, which was the worst meal we had during our entire 8 days in Spain. By the end of our stay, my boyfriend and I had determined that Banys Orientals is badly managed, and while staff blend in with the sex appeal and design sense of the hotel, they lack the warmth and hospitality most of us seek when travelling abroad and exploring a new city. Stay in this neighborhood, but find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location...”
Reviews.Author: IanNon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this simplistic and modernly decorated hotel in central Barcelona. It was in a great district close to some Tapas bars and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and we couldn't fault anything. There is no room service, but you can help yourself to the free bottled water supplied in a fridge on each floor. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “price - quality - service = excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Pauli_NL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this fantastic small hotel several times, by myself, with clients in form of a small group and with friends. Whichever the purpose of my stay, staff has always been helpful and flexible with any kind of demands. They have at all times been going out of their way to ensure great service to my clients. Placing the reservation may need a little patience. But once you're set, you'll be set. Location of the hotel is top. It's located in the center of the most hip area of Barcelona. Surrounded by great tapas bars, hip stores (not the standard shops you find in every city), main attractions are in walking distance, metro station is only a second's walk from the hotel. Breakfast is extensive and very good. The rooms are big enough to enjoy your stay. Bathrooms are large (in comparison to other city hotels in Europe). Amenities are great. Internet cxn incl. Complementary bottled water in a fridge on each floor. It's a little hideaway in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Banys”
Reviews.Author: eJono
Reviews.Content: Frankly, if you're sat there reading this review you're wasting time that could be much better spent booking this great little hotel. We had a 2 night stay in one of the suites (all the normal rooms were gone). The booking service was good, and email confirmation was sent within minutes. On arrival, our bags were carried up to the suite by a very nice bloke and we were left alone in a beautifully cool and spacious room, complete with mezzanine, enormous bed, fridge stacked with complimentary water and balcony overlooking some of Barcelona's best bits. The windows shut tight to block out all but the noisiest of party-ers while blackout curtains ensure an undisturbed night's sleep, meaning your stay is as peaceful and relaxing as it is comfortable. What's so amazing about this place, however, are the prices. Our suite was 125 Euros (about £90) per night for two people, which was amazing considering what you get, and the standard rooms are much cheaper. We'll be back again, and reserve a little earlier to make sure we get in. Seriously, stop reading and book it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mcglashams
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It was in a perfect location right in the middle of the old town and a fifteen minute walk from Las Ramblas. The hotel itself is clean, attractive and is highly recommended by us. We did not eat there as there are so many good restaurants round about. The food market in Las Ramblas has an abundance of fresh fruits etc so this was a good place to sit and eat breakfast amongst the locals. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, the only thing I would advise is to confirm your bookings before arrival as there was a discrepancy with ours.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all !!”
Reviews.Author: edstraker123
Reviews.Content: Having booked Banys on the recommendation of a colleague we were a bit concerned having read some of the less than positive reviews on this site, however we can only say we had a fabulous time here with no problems at all. We had booked one of the suites and on arrival the receptionist carried my wife's case to our room which was less than a minute away from the main hotel. The suites are entered through two iron security gates and up a a staircase. We were quite happy that these gates were in place as the road that the Hotel is located on is very busy with pedestrians and having left quite a lot of electrical equipment in the room the extra security gives additional peace of mind. We stayed in suite A1 and it was very similar to the photos shown on the website. We did find that the suite was quite dark although we did think that this was in keeping with the style of the room and there were numerous lamps and spotlights to brighten things up. As mentioned in previous reviews there is a fridge in the room stocked with still and sparkling water and any used bottles are replaced free of charge each day. On the mezzanine level there was a large couch and a lamp which was perfect for relaxing and applying sun tan lotion ! The bathroom was quite small containing a shower and toilet with the sink being located outside.We certainly did not have any problems with a lack of hot water as had been reported by a previous reviewer. The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic, being set in the vibrant El Born distict of the gothic quarter. There are numerous shops, bars and restaurants nearby, but we especially liked Les Quinze Nits located about a 10 minute walk away in Placa Reial. The menu is quite simple but everything we tried was absolutely delicious - so much so that we ate there 5 times ! It is also unbelivable value for money - 3 course meal for two with a bottle of wine and coffees was about 40 Euros ! The restaurant is really popular with queues starting about 30 minutes before opening time - we estimated that there must have been about 100 people in front of us one night, but having been seated, the service was fantastic. Another favorite and highly recomended place is La Vinya del Senyor located in Placa de Santa Maria which as would be expected only serves wines. The staff were extremely knowledgable and helpful and as a lover of dessert wines we discovered the ultimate in Castano Dulce which was absolutely amazing. All in all this was one of the most enjoyable holidays my wife and I have had in a long time and based on our experiences would recommend Banys Orientals and Barcelona to everybody, it is unbeatable for value and second to none for location.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: cottonstones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at The Banys Oriental Hotel for a long weekend in Barcelona. We selected the hotel based on location and price. We stayed in one of the suites which were located in another building a couple of minutes walk away.The entrance/lobby to this building was drab and dark with a tiny lift serving the suites. The staircase was like a fire escape and the layout complicated. It was very unwelcoming. The suite was a decent size and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom looked good but using the facilities was tricky. The shower leaked all over the floor and the glass door leading to the toilet was heavy and difficult to open. We ate breakfast in the hotel on the first morning which was dreadful. The buffet selection was poor and there were cleaning products left by the cleaner stacked in a corner smelling of bleach. The Taller de Tapas on the same street serves an excellent breakfast so we ate there instead. Overall the hotel was reasonable value for money but we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Mark91604
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about Hotel Banys Orientals. Pros: Forget the Ramblas, the hotel is in the best part of Barcelona, El Born. More restaurants, wine bars and medieval ambience than one could shake a leg of ham at. The adjoining restaurant was one of our favorites (we eat there twice). The free water was nice and often needed. Cool suites with modern look and the price was right. Cons: The sleek modern look was better viewed from the Internet than in person. For example, instead of removing the old decor, i.e., sinks, cabinets, etc. the hotel simply installed false walls to cover it up; a bit strange. This leads to the biggest con, because of limited space do to the false walls, they only installed a 10-gallon hot water heater. It lasted exactly 9 minutes; we timed it, and took 4 hours to reheat. We either showered together (very small shower) or, one at night and one in the mourning. The suite had a large two-story window that looked out at the staircase, not much of a view. Noise wasn’t much of an issue but in the busy season I could see how it would be. The staff is young and not very helpful or knowledgeable. Things to be aware of: There are two different suite buildings, one building is right next to the main hotel and the other is 300 yards away, down a small dark alley. After complaining about the limited hot water, the hotel offered to move us to one of the suites down the street, which has newer hot water systems. We got an uneasy feeling about the location and declined. So uneasy, in fact, we would rather take 4-minute shows than stay there. As for the standard rooms located in the main building, they seemed fine but small. However, be aware many rooms and even entire floors were unfinished. Guests had to climb over paint cans and other debris to get to there rooms. Like my title, I have mixed feelings, it’s not a hotel for everyone, certainly not travels how require attentive staff and hassle free rooms. If this hotel was located anywhere else I would give it 1 star but location, location, location…

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bany's Orientals”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic 2 night stay at hotel Bany's Orientals- we were a largegroup of 25 on my hen party weekend and had a mixture of twin rooms and suites. All were modern in style and clean and the free water was a great bonus! I was worried the suites would be too far away from the main hotel building but this is not the case- they are literally a stones throw away from the front entrance.
