Breakfast is continental and really nice. Location- great, close to harbour, cathedral, shops, bars and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again- next time with my hubby! Barcelona is GORGEOUS!!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. The hotel is quite nice looking and the rooms are quite nice - as long as your not put in a single room under the staircase. The receptionists were far more interested in their own appearance than helping with any problems we may have had. Barcelona is a great city but this hotel ruined our trip and New Year... stay away!! Oh the food in the restaurant is great... but unfortunately the restaurant has very little to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Banys orientals -so good I went back for a second visit!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Banys Orientals in July 2005 with a hen party. Enjoyed 2 nights there. Location excellent. Clean comfortable rooms with ultra modern decor. Nice large walk in shower. Free chilled bottled water was a godsend with a huge fridge on each landing full of the stuff. Located in the heart of the bario gothic near the cathedral. Very central for sightseeing. Liked it so much went back again in Sept. 2005 with partner. Good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Banys Orientals after a 2 night stay for my hen weekend. We stayed in the suites which are about 5 minutes from the main hotel, they are fantastic! We booked 3 suites for 8 of us, all 3 suites were slightly different but all equally as nice. The main bedroom was huge with a big 4-poster style bed with 2 single matresses, there was also a tv, desk and fridge in the room. We also had a room with a single bed and then the bathroom which was very modern (the best power shower I've ever had!). We had 3 patio doors which led out onto a long balcony so you could see the goings on in the street. The rooms were very clean, I defnately have no complaints about this hotel and will hopefully be returning very soon. The location is excellent with lots of bar and cafe's nearby, also just 5 mins taxi away from la ramblas. Would highly recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Banys Oriental is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: saytheword04
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just returned from the Banys Oriental. We stayed there from Feb. 19 - 22nd. First off, the location is unbelievably great. You're walking distance to almost everything. I can't comment on Breakfast, since we did not pay for that as we planned to have coffee and whatever in a local cafe daily. and there are MANY local cafe's to grab a bite at. The best coffee is at a franchise near the hotel called Cappachino. Anyway, we asked for two adjoining rooms and unfortunately, they did not have two next door to each other the day we arrived. But the hotel did arrange for us to be together (next door to one another) from the second day until we left. They even moved my friends luggage. The rooms are basically clean and simple. Much better than a motel 6 and you certainly cannot expect the Ritz Carlton for the price you're paying at Banys. WE had a fantastically comfortable bed, roomy bathrooms and yes, there is definitely a musty smell but it did not bother us. We had a great view of the street below and it was NOT noisy as other areas. For 95Euros, you're getting a steal. The best bargain though, is the Banys restaurant right next door. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation. The place always has a line to get in......the food is out of this world. Enjoy your trip if you're headed out to this wonderful little world. saytheword (NYC)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Banys for two nights, just to spend the Weekend in Barcelona and found it very nice and comfortable. I lived for one year in Barcelona and know the city centre very well. Bany Orientals is located perfectly in the heart of the Gótico Area and you really find everything near to you (even Metro and Bus). The value you get for the money you pay is above average for Barcelona. Even for bad Hostals I paid only 20 EUR less, compared to Banys Orientals, if you like the Hostal rooms with own bathroom. The Hotel has a very nice abstract and cosy style, the breakfast is very good and the service as well. If you get a room to the street it is of corse not very silent, but this is the charme of the mediteranean City of Barcelona. Some small things of course are nice to see, but not very good to use. The lightning of the bathroom indeed should be improved (especially at the sink and mirror), but this wasn´t really a problem. I felt very good "at home" in the Banys Orientals rooms. Especially our room had two levels. Entering you could go directly in the bathroom/WC. Going some steps down (wooden steps in the material of the floor, very nice!) there was a hugh bed that was of a good quality. A small balcony to look, what is going on on the street, a big window with good curtains (no light enters at morning!) a small table with nice lamps on it, pictures on the wall - all those things made it overall a nice space to stay. Not very big, but to relax after walks through Barcelona. I will go to BO again. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “All form, no function”
Reviews.Author: nyuszi
Reviews.Content: Bany's Orientals is an absolutely beautiful hotel! It's designed and decorated with a kind of stylish simplicity that I associate with the West's take on the East (particularly Japan). I stayed for business, so I was thrilled that it was not just an identical box business hotel. The location was excellent, as well. The included breakfast was great, including items sure to please Spaniards, Brits, and Americans alike, plus it was served until fairly late so it was very convenient. The bed was comfortable, with clean soft linens. Unfortunately, all the goodness was packed into the superficial level, leaving a lot to be desired. There was no internet service available in the hotel, the heating/cooling unit was so high tech that it was impossible to program, and there was no overhead light so even with every lamp turned on and the curtains open, it was difficult to see. The bathroom is also beautifully useless. The sink design makes one very apt to spray themselves or the room, the shower design makes that absolutely certain, and the lack of ventilation left me with a thin film of condensation on every surface when I finished.

Reviews.Title: “Banys a sobre choice”
Reviews.Author: cpttraveller
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Casa Camper before moving to Banys Orientals, we were not overly excited to be checking in. But we knew that there is a reason why Banys charges E100 and Camper E200! When we arrived, we were informed that the hotel does not know about our booking! Fortunately I had a printout of an email confirmation, which, upon presentation, quickly sorted out the confusion. We actually hoped that they did not have any rooms, so that we had a reason to go back to the Camper (which in reality we could not afford for another night!) In the end, we got one of the streetfacing rooms on the first floor, which was nice and spacious. Pros: - Nice design, although the monochrome colours seemed a bit dull after the bright reds of the Camper. - Free water good since Barcelona's tastes awful. - Although the hotel does not have wi-fi, I was given an ethernet cable to connect to the port in the room. This worked perfectly. - Nice bathroom, although some of the tiles in the shower need to be replaced. Strange double taps? Cons - Soundproofing. The problem bothered us at first, but we got used to it. One can hear people talking on the street even with all the windows closed. Occasionaly we could hear conversations and tv in the room next door. The problem is manageable and not quite as bad as some other reviews have made it out to be. All in all, at about E100 for a double, Banys Orientals is a sobre choice if one of your prerequisites is nice design. I have done a lot of research on boutique hotels in Barcelona in this pricerange, and this still seems to be the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit in 18 months”
Reviews.Author: gargas
Reviews.Content: Yes, the bathrooms smell - though I think it's less due to lack of cleanliness and more due to a lack of ventilation - and yes there's a bit of noise from the uncarpeted hallways and streets outside, but the location is unparalleled, and the price is unbeatable. While you don't get amenities like room service or laundry, you do get a very helpful staff and all the bottled water you can drink. And, for not too much more money, the suites are huge with nicer bathrooms - though they are in buildings separate from the main hotel. I'll go back for a 4th trip. The only thing I'd change would be giving out a set of earplugs with each room - we brought our own and it makes all the differnce in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustinThyme
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a stylish modern hotel with a high tech look straight from Architectural Digest, this is for you. The rates are reasonable too. A nice experience and conveniently located, particularly if you're looking for a stopover before joiing a ship in the port. Would return again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but little else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Spain for our honeymoon and stayed in one of the suites at the Hotel Banys Oriental for six nights. The suites are not in the same building as the hotel, which we knew. However, when we entered the building where the suites were located, it was literally like entering a prison. We passed through a metal gate door which you have to slam shut for it to lock. Then we walked up two flights of stairs into a cement courtyard (we called it the dungeon) to get to our room. There was a loud refrigerator there holding the bottled water. There were no plants, very little lighting (which seemed dangerous since the door was hardly ever closed and locked), no chairs or table -- just a dark, windy, and a liitle scary area to pass through before entering your room. Fortunately we were on the first level. Other guests had to climb an enormous metal staircase with their luggage to get to their rooms -- there is no elevator. There are also no employees in the suite building. The room did look like the pictures we have seen online, but some things have to be noted in person. The floors which appear to be hardwood, are in fact, vinyl - made to look like wood. This would have been okay (albeit a little cheesy) except that they were filthy and bumpy. The lighting in the room, the bathroom, and the loft space was so poor that it was quite depressing. There is no overhead lighting - only one floor lamp (which we moved down from the loft because we literally couldn't see) and 2 table lamps, all with low wattage bulbs. The bed frame was a made out of a cheap wood painted black -- ikea-esque, but worse, with screws sticking out on the bottom. There were 2 strange clip lights on the bed frame that were like car headlights. As it was November, and getting cold, we could understand the room being a bit cold, but our room was unbearably cold. We turned the temperature up as high as it could go, and it was still too chilly to stay in there any longer than we had to. The loft space was boiling hot, and the downstairs was icy. Not to mention that the room was so dark and dreary that we wanted to be anywhere else. We tried to change hotels, but were unable to find anything. We called to tell them about the lighting situation and the freezing temp, and they said that it would be warmer and brighter in the morning with the light streaming through the windows. That never happened, even on a bright sunny day. It was dark, cold and depressing for the duration of our stay. When we say dark, I mean, we could not see our clothes in the suitcase! We asked to change rooms, but nothing was available. The bathroom was more of the same -- dark and cold -- very unpleasant. The boiler broke in our room the day before we left and we had no hot water. They said that it could not be fixed until the following day when we were checking out anyway. We were also unsure of the cleanliness of everything. For the six days that we were there, the sink area was never cleaned -- made us wonder what else was never cleaned. We know that they did not change the sheets on the bed either. The breakfast, although plentiful was a bit disappointing. It seemed as though not everything was so fresh -- some stale bread, cheese that sat out for too long. But overall we were able to eat well enough to start our day. We did not have any English channels on our tv which would have been nice to have during siesta time. There were a few upsides -- the price, location, and the free bottled water. We would not recommend this hotel for more than 2 nights. We also suggest staying in the main hotel instead of the suites. Our overall opinion was that on the surface everything looks good, but underneath there was not much quality.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three week day nights in early November. E90 per night. I was by myself but had a double room (which I had booked because a single was not available). The room was on the second floor (105) at the back and was very quiet. I know that others have complained about the thin walls and noise from outside but I heard nothing. Excellent cold breakfast buffet for E9.60 - cereals, fresh fruit, cold cuts, cheese, juice, coffee etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke English. There was a safe in the room (enter a 4 digit combination). Room was all black and white decorations and was very clean. Very nice having free cold bottled water available. The location was excellent - steps from the Jaume subway station and the Cathedral. I would certainly stay there again. andrew

Reviews.Title: “On the whole....fab”
Reviews.Author: Ginner_7
Reviews.Content: I have to say that most of the reviews are spot on. IT IS a lovely little hotel, great value, great location, nice staff, and I would without a doubt stay there again. They are a couple of things that others have mentioned which are also true, thin walls (felt like someone else was in the room) and it was a bit of a tight squeeze around the bed, but that was it. I had friends staying in one of the suites and that was great, so if you want a bit more of a treat for an extra 30 euros book one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hellomachka
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed one night in this cute "W"esque hotel; i would definitely stay here again; it was a great value at 90 euro per night for a double. Most, not all, of the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean as were the bathrooms. It is in a great location near the Gothic area as well as the trains. Walking distance to plaza catalunya & tons of shopping & restaurants!!! There was a huge refridgerator with complimentary bottled water in the hallway which was definitely a plus! We did not have the chance to eat in the restaurant in the hotel, but it looked very cute! Walls were thin but we did not have any trouble as far as noisy neighbors. Television had english channels (which we didn't find anywhere else).

Reviews.Title: “a booking that did not happen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel on trip advisor suggestion. sent visa number as confirmation, when arrived did not have our booking and we had to find alternative accom, when we arrived home found they had deducted amount from our visa account, sent an email to them and so far have not had any reply. We are currently trying to recover funds through the bank. I would definatly not advise using this hotel. Went to hotel colon which was fantastic. Cheryl Wilsmore.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, fairly clean but NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel for a very good price (93 euro/night for double room excluding tax). Polite and efficient staff. Excellent location. Free water on all floors (still/sparkling). Close to metro. HOWEVER, bathroom clean but not spotless (shower was powerful though). Tiles and grouting are black so may be even less clean than appears. Most of space in room was taken up with the large double bed. And finally the rooms are very noisy. We moved from room 100 (as we may as well have been sleeping on the street-noise began from about 7 am) to room 304 (which had slightly less noise from street but transmitted every sound from our neighbours room-and they were not noisy). Overall would probably not return...or return with earplugs.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Banys Orientals
HotelInfo.Address: c/ Argenteria 37, 08003 Barcelona, Spain
